Zhang Guocai's Lung Consumption Formula

Seventy pearls, half a penny of cinnabar, two pennies each of ginseng and licorice, half a character of musk, five pennies of light powder, one white atractylodes.

Preparation: First, crush and fry the ginseng and licorice until cooked, prepare the white atractylodes by roasting and grinding it finely. Then mix in the pearls, cinnabar, musk, and light powder thoroughly. Take half a penny or one character at a time, boiled in silver mint soup for adjustment. Take once daily after meals. Only three doses are needed for recovery from lung consumption.[100p]

　　肺疳方　庄氏第三候，鼻下赤烂，爱揉眼，兼血痢，是肺疳。乃因吃着乘热物，或病奶所损心肺，加之咳嗽，更以服凉冷药过多，便上热下冷，渐渐昏沉，日夜烦哭。　　龙脑　朱砂各一分　钩藤　元参各一两　胡黄连炮半两　麝香一钱　　右为末，炼蜜丸如黄米大，米饮下三丸至五丸。

Lung Scabs Formula

For the third condition of the Zhuang clan, when there is red ulceration beneath the nose, an inclination to rub the eyes, and concurrent bloody dysentery, this indicates lung scabs. It is caused by consuming hot foods, or damage to the heart and lungs from illness, compounded by coughing, and excessive use of cooling medications which leads to a state of warmth above and cold below, gradually resulting in lethargy and persistent crying day and night.

Ingredients:

  • Dragon's Brain (Long Nao) - 1 part
  • Cinnabar (Zhu Sha) - 1 part
  • Vine Twig (Gou Teng) - 1 tael
  • Scrophularia (Yuan Shen) - 1 tael
  • Fried False Yellow Root (Hu Huang Lian) - 0.5 tael
  • Musk (She Xiang) - 0.1 tael

Grind these into a powder, then mix with honey to form pills as large as millet, taken with rice drink, three to five pills at a time.

Great Toad Pill

Used to treat children suffering from a thin neck and head, abdominal distension, dry and wrinkled skin, brittle yellow hair, red ulceration beneath the nose, sores on the tongue and mouth, and persistent diarrhea, leading to gradual emaciation.

Take one great toad, remove the four legs, split open the abdomen, and remove the intestines. Add one tael of fried false yellow root inside, sew it up, wrap it in three layers of damp paper, cover with mud to hold it together, and dry it on all sides. With gentle heat, drive out the cold essence, then burn it over three pounds of charcoal until it is entirely red and has cooled cleanly. Remove the mud, grind it into a fine powder, and mix it with the following, finely ground into a paste:

  • Musk - 0.5 tael
  • Bear Gall (Xiong Dan) - 0.5 tael
  • Aloe (Lu Hui) - 0.5 tael

Form into pills as large as sesame seeds, taken with rice drink, or breast milk if available. For children over three years old, increase the amount of pills.[101p]

Various Herbal Formulas:

For Treating Pediatric Five Types of Dysentery:
To address children's symptoms of five types of dysentery, abdominal distension, emaciation, dry and brittle hair, and ulcers in the mouth and nose.
Use Night Bright Sand, wash it in water five times and then dry it. Stir-fry White Wormwood and Coptis until charred. Use one ounce each of Coptis. Grind them into a powder. Mix with the bile of a wild pig and form into pills the size of mung beans; take three to five pills without regard to time, and take with warm water made from cooked Ophiopogon. If long-standing dysentery is present and no effect from medications is observed, or if there is severe abdominal distension and inability to eat, take rice water to discharge the dysentery worms, leading to recovery. This formula is used by the Zhuang family in the eighth method.

Adjusting the Source Powder:
For those lacking in original vital energy, experience a sense of pressure in the head, muscle wasting, and abdominal swelling, leading to delayed speech and movement, slow tooth eruption, and a dull complexion, this formula is effective.
Five qian of dry Chinese yam, Ginseng, White Poria, Poria with the spirit, White Atractylodes, White Peony, cooked Rehmannia, prepared Angelica wine-washed, and honey-fried Astragalus, each two and a half qian; three qian each of Chuanxiong and honey-fried Licorice; two qian of gypsum. Grind these together. Take two qian each time, mix with one cup of water, two slices of ginger, and one jujube, simmer down to seven parts. Take warm at any time. If for infants, the nursing mother should also take it.

Nine Flavor Rehmannia Pills:
For treating kidney-related dysentery.
Four and a half qian of cooked Rehmannia, red Poria, crude Cornelian cherry fruit, Chipolia fruit, Angelica, Chuanxiong, Peony root, Chinese yam, and Quisqualis fruit, each two qian. Grind into powder, form into honey pills the size of tung seeds; take eighty pills each time with warm wine on an empty stomach.[102p]

　　张涣熊胆散　治急疳，虫伤脏腑，上蚀口齿，生疮赤烂，世呼为走马疳。　　莨菪子炒令微黑　虾蟆灰　白矾各半两　生硫黄一分。已上捣末，入　熊胆半两，细研　麝香　雄黄　芦荟各一分，并细研　　右件药，一处拌匀为细末，每服一字，煎荆芥汤调下。如有疮处，宜薄敷之。如鼻痒，即取少许，逐日吹鼻中，日三两上。
　　熊胆膏　截急疳病。

Zhang Huan's Bear Gall Powder treats acute scrofula, caused by insect bites affecting the internal organs, eroding the mouth and teeth, causing sores and decay, commonly called "running horse scrofula." Prepare half a tael of fried cocklebur seeds until slightly blackened, along with half a tael each of toad ash and white alum, and one part of raw sulfur. Grind these into a powder, then add half a tael of bear gall, finely grind together with one part each of musk, realgar, and aloe, blending until uniform into a fine powder. For each dose, take a character size and decoct it in a soup of schisandra. If there are sores, apply a thin layer. If there is nasal itching, take a little and blow it into the nostrils, two to three times daily.

Bear Gall Ointment halts acute scrofula.

Using half a tael of bear gall, one part each of python bile, aloe, and cattle bile, and a penny’s worth of borneol and musk, all finely ground. Mix these thoroughly with a small cup of well water, and cook gently in a ceramic vessel until it turns into an ointment. For each dose, take a pea-sized amount, dissolve it in mint soup, and also apply to the affected area. One variation adds yellow alum.

Li Sheng Ointment treats invasive acute scrofula.

Combine half a cup of human milk with one grain-sized portion of yellow alum, one jujube-sized portion of white alum, and one pea-sized portion of stone gall, all finely ground. Wrap these in cotton and immerse them in the milk overnight. If the milk has flavor, simmer gently until it forms an ointment. Take a little for oral application. If there are sores in the nose, apply a few drops. If there is swelling, prick it with a three-edged needle to drain the blood, then apply this ointment.[103p]

Er Jin San - For treating severe poisonous dysentery.
One part arsenic, half a tael of musk - Take arsenic and roast it on paper first, then mix it with musk and grind it finely. For each application, use a chicken feather to brush it on the sore, three times daily, and remove any excess medicine immediately without swallowing saliva.

One part indigo, bitter neem bark, night-bright sand, cinquefoil, aloe, coptis, gall, and dried toad, a little musk, and one part cicada shell (removing the mouth and claws); five large pig gall bladders are mixed and roasted. Zeng's Aloe Pills are intended for the treatment of five types of dysentery and eight types of diarrhea, tapeworms, weak organs, thin body, sparse and brittle hair, bloating with blue veins, cloudy urine, excessive thirst, unregulated diarrhea, difficulty in digesting food, skin sores, and dryness of spirit and complexion. Ingredients:

  • South Wood Fragrance: 2.5 qian
  • Cloves: 2.5 qian
  • Haritaki (remove pit and take flesh): 4 qian
  • Nutmeg: 0.5 liang
  • Quince flesh: 4 qian
  • Date flesh: 1 liang, thinly sliced and baked slowly on a tile until dry.

Preparation:
The south wood fragrance and the other four ingredients (except for quince flesh) should be finely crushed in a mortar. Then, wrap with wet dough and steam until fragrant. Grind the date flesh and aloe into fine powder, mix it back into the mortar with the crushed quince flesh, and form into pills the size of hemp seeds. Take 30 to 55 pills with warm rice soup, and it should be taken on an empty stomach. For children, dissolve in rice soup.[105p]

  • Aloe, finely ground (each one qian)
  • Chuan Kuling (one fen, roasted to purple color)
  • Barley malt (half a tael)
  • Three to seven seeds of Ba Dou, peeled and with the heart removed; use only the malt to ensure the sprouts turn purple.

Mix these into a fine powder, grind to uniformity. Form into pills the size of a mung bean, take ten to fifteen pills with rice drink, without any timing constraints. This medicine effectively treats children's abdominal distension due to malnutrition.

Wu's Huangqi Decoction treats childhood ailments related to weak spleens, abdominal bloating, jaundice, intermittent fever, and gradual weight loss or diarrhea.

Ingredients:

  • Huangqi (one tael)
  • Ren Shen
  • Chen Pi (slightly roasted without removing white parts)
  • Bai Fuling
  • Bai Binglang (very large pieces)
  • Zhi Cao (each half a tael)
  • One small fruit of Rou Dou Kou

Grind these into a coarse powder, take three qian with one large cup of water, simmer over low heat until reduced to seven-tenths, strain out the residue, and take warm, as needed.[112p]

Zhao's Family Tradition Formula

To treat children's five sores, reduce jaundice and skin irritations, relieve accumulated heat, calm fright, and improve appetite.

Use 21 parts of the gentleman herb, 0.5 taels of Hu Huanglian, 1 part of Wulingzhi, and 1 part of roasted toad head, all charred. Add 0.5 qian of musk, ground; 2 qians each of aloe and bear bile, also ground.

Mix these into a powder, using millet rice to form pills the size of mung beans. Take 20 pills with rice drink.

Additionally, to treat children's five sores, characterized by a yellowish and emaciated complexion, feverish body, inability to digest milk and food, watery eyes, phlegm and saliva in the chest, a craving for sour and salty foods, and frequent diarrhea:

Use half a tael each of Hu Huanglian, mother cloves, and stir-fried Huanglian, along with half a tael of aloe and bear bile, and 1 part of musk, finely ground. Prepare 1 roasted toad head, charred to a golden yellow.

Mix this into a powder and form pills the size of mung beans using cattle bile. For the fourth condition of the Zhuang family, use this formula.

If there are heart sores, decoct Wu Yí and licorice soup and take 3 pills. For food sores causing blood diarrhea or red and white dysentery, take 3 pills with freshly drawn water. For persistent vomiting and watery diarrhea, use ginger soup. For eye sores, mix sheep liver blood with wine, then slightly decoct and take 3 pills.[113p]

Holy Grace Turtle Shell Powder
Treats childhood indiscriminate malnutrition, with narrow neck and large abdomen, hair dry and standing upright like bristles.
Three parts of turtle shell, fried in fat until yellow and removing its skirt; three betel nuts; fragrant sandalwood; rush-leaved plant; slightly fried burdock; quinafruit; red peony; skins of hawthorn; half a tael each of roasted licorice.
Crush and sieve the above ingredients into a powder. Each dose is one qian, boiled in a small cup of water until reduced to five parts, then strain. Adjust the dosage based on the child's size and serve warm, without worrying about timing.

Fragrant Shell Decoction
Stops malnutrition and wards off evil.
One tael of rush-leaved plant; sanded sandalwood; fried burdock; slightly toasted hawthorn skin; resin; turtle shell fried in fat until yellow and removing its skirt; ground frankincense, half a tael each.
Crush and sieve into a fine powder. Mix with frankincense, each dose is one qian, boiled in eight parts of water, with a small amount of ginseng added, cooking for four parts, then strain and serve warm, adjusting based on the child's size.

Jade Powder
Stabilizes diarrhea and prevents malnutrition.

Loulu Wan: This treats children with unwarranted malnutrition, diarrhea, weakness, lack of appetite, and the presence of worms in the belly, often vomiting clear water. Use two taels of Loulu, one tael of dried pig liver, and one tael of shredded white bark of the paper mulberry root.

Another Recipe: For unending unwarranted diarrhea in children.

Lujin Kidney Scripture, Vermilion Pill
Treats children's malnutrition and dysentery, identifies the color of worms, and determines fortune.

Holy Benefice Dry Toad Pill
Treats children's five types of malnutrition, convulsions, and determines life and death of worms.

Musk Pill: Treats children's five types of malnutrition with weakness, dry and brittle hair, and itchy mouth and nose with worms. Aloe Pill: Treats children's five types of malnutrition, with thin limbs, bloated abdomen, coarse gas, and frequent rubbing of nose and eyes. It is advisable to take this to eliminate worms. Ingredients: Aloe, Bovine Gall, Cicada Shell, each one part; fatty powder, powdered frost, sulfur, musk, each one qian (approximately 3 grams); one farmer's field, burnt until the smoke stops; half an ounce of indigo; ten grains of croton for powder; one snake shed skin, burnt to ash. After a while, boil peach willow water and bathe the child, then cover the whole body with a green garment; worms will emerge. White and yellow ones are treatable, while blue and black ones are hard to treat.[120p]

　　出虫丸　治小儿五疳久不瘥，羸瘦极甚。　　朱砂　麝香　牛黄　蜗牛子炒　夜明沙炒　熊胆各一分　蟾酥半钱　　右件药都细研，以面糊和丸如菉豆大，每服以温水下三丸，更别以水研一丸，滴向鼻中，得嚏五七声，良久，当有虫随汗出，立效。

Chong Wan (Bug Pills): Used to treat children with persistent five kinds of pustules and extreme emaciation. Ingredients: one part of cinnabar, musk, ox gall, stir-fried snail's egg, stir-fried night-bright sand, and bear bile; half a penny of toad venom. Grind all these ingredients finely, mix with flour to form pills the size of a pea. Take three pills with warm water, and separately grind one pill with water and drop it into the nose. After sneezing five to seven times, the bugs should come out with the sweat, resulting in immediate effectiveness.

Gan Chan Wan (Dried Toad Pills): Used to treat children's bugs from the five kinds of pustules. Ingredients: one dried toad, ashes, half a tael of ashes from the top of the head, half a part of musk, stir-fried cicada shells without legs, and roasted tortoise shell toasted to yellow crispness, each one part. Grind all these into a fine powder; form rice-sized pills for use. For children under two years old, administer one pill with clam powder soup; for children aged three to five, administer two pills. After taking the medicine, continue with a peach and willow soup bath for the child, then cover with a green cloth. The bugs that come out will appear red or white if light, and black if heavy.[121p]

　　定命散　治五疳有虫。

　　青黛丸　治五疳体热干瘦，发立鼻痒，有虫，不欲饮乳。　　青黛　芦会　人中白各半两　牙皂　蝉壳　麝香各一分　胡连三分　蟾涎　人乳各少许　　右件为末，五月五日午时修合，以粽子肉、枣肉及蟾涎、乳汁丸如黍米大。以桃柳汤浴儿后，以米饮下三丸，后用青衣裹儿，看身上有虫出，青黑者不治，黄白赤者易瘥。[122p]

Bear Gallbladder Pills - For treating children's five types of malnutrition with worms.
Ingredients: True bear gallbladder, cinnabar, musk, python gall, fried dung beetle, melon seed tips, each half a tael. Grind these into a very fine powder, mix well. Use wild boar gallbladder juice to form pills the size of a mung bean. First, bathe the child in peach and willow decoction, then swallow three pills with rice porridge; cover with a blue garment. This should help expel the worms.

Dingming Powder - For five types of malnutrition with worms.
Ingredients: One dried shrimp (worm grass), ash from burning, snake skin (fried), and cicada shell each one part. Grind these into a very fine powder, and mix in half a qian of musk powder. For all types of malnutrition, after noon, dissolve half a qian in warm water and give to children aged one or two. Afterwards, bathe the child in peach and willow decoction, then cover with a blue garment. This should help expel the worms and is effective.

Qingdai Pills - For five types of malnutrition with body heat, dry and thin, causing itchy nostrils, with worms that the child does not want to drink milk.
Ingredients: Qingdai (indigo), lily bulb, human milk white each half a tael; soapwort, cicada shell, musk each one part; hu lian (a plant) three parts; toad venom, human milk each a little. Grind these into a powder and prepare on the noon of the fifth day of the fifth month, forming pills the size of millet with rice meat, jujube meat, toad venom, and milk. After bathing the child in peach and willow decoction, swallow three pills with rice drink, then cover the child with a blue garment, checking for worms. Black-blue worms are not treated, while yellow, white, and red ones are easier to cure.[122p]

Qian Yi's Yu Ren Wan treats malnutrition and thinness from heat in children, with parasites; long-term use can help gain weight. Ingredients: Yu Ren and Huang Lian, each one tael. Shi Jun Zi San treats roundworm infestations in children. Ingredients: ten Shi Jun Zi, stir-fry and grind into a powder; Gan Cao, pig gall juice; Bai Wu Ti, each one fen; five Ku Ling Zi, roasted and pitted. Mix the powder and take one qian boiled in water.

Zhang Huan’s prescription for treating intestinal worms causing incessant crying. It is particularly severe at the beginning of the month, resembling possession by a spirit.

Ingredients:

  • Three roots: Guanzhong root, hawthorn root, and pomegranate root, each one tael;
  • Chestnut prickles, old cotton, and dried lacquer, each half a tael.

Combine these six ingredients, burn them to ashes, then grind and sift into a powder. Administer one qian mixed with eight parts water, boil down to four parts, strain out the dregs, let it cool, and take it without regard to timing.

Antitoxin Pill: Effective for intestinal worms, contagious among siblings.

Ingredients:

  • One tael of Ghostbroom (with hairs removed);
  • Half tael each of bitter sophora, blue nightshade seeds, and gallbladder grass;
  • One fen each of sulfur, red silk, dry shrimp (or bug powder), and white alum.

Grind these medicinal ingredients to a fine powder after burning them to ashes. Mix with honey to form small pellets like sesame seeds. Take ten pellets with a dose of sandalwood tea, adjusting the amount according to the child’s size.

Pig Stomach Pill: Treats children's wasting due to intestinal worms, night sweats, and fatigue with low energy. Highly effective in the past.

Ingredients:

  • One tael each of cleaned Sichuan coptis, Hu coptis, and guaiac wood;
  • Half tael each of qianghuo (notopterygium), aloe, nutmeg (with flesh extracted), and turtle shell (roasted and de-skirted);
  • Half tael of white peony root.

Grind these ingredients into a fine powder. Take one pig stomach, clean it thoroughly, then steam it with two taels of fragrant white angelica until very well done. Discard the angelica, insert the other herbs, sew it up, and steam it again until it becomes mushy. Take it out and mash it 200-300 times into a paste. Form into pills the size of millet, taking ten pills with rice drink, without regard to timing, adjusting quantity according to child size.[124p]

Gujing Dan treats various diseases caused by pests that resemble fine hair or horse tails, which can lead to severe consequences.

For preparation, take three to two liang of Gujing grass, place it in a jar with salt and clay, and simmer it over a low fire until it turns red. Then add three dried toads, roasted to a yellow color on May 5, and three inches of burnt saussurea. Additionally, add half a liang of each of the following: hu-lian, gourd stems, and mother clove. Grind all into a fine powder, then add one fen each of powdered frost, aloe, and musk, and grind these finely. Mix everything thoroughly, combining it with pig bile to form small pills the size of millet. Take ten pills at a time with warm rice water, adjusting the dosage according to the child's size.

Peach and Willow Decoction can be used after taking various medicines to aid recovery.

Take two liang each of peach and willow branches, chop them finely and boil in two large bowls of water until several boils occur. It is very beneficial for bathing children. After the bath, cover the child with a blue garment to expel the parasites as evidence.

Kuling Pills treat children who meet symptoms like pallor, sudden loud crying resembling heart pain, and often dry mouth. Sometimes, doctors may misdiagnose these symptoms as possession, not realizing the child may have eaten raw meat, which has turned into pests. This remedy is very effective.

Take one liang each of bitter neem root, Herba Sargentodoxa, and cinnabar, along with three betel nuts and one qian of musk. Grind these into powder and mix into small bean-sized pills. Take two pills at a time with white soup, three times a day. Avoid poisonous substances.[125p]

Immortal Water Inspection Prescription: For children under two years who sleep excessively and have their faces on the ground, this indicates dampness in the brain. Wang's Handwritten Collection of Prescriptions

For treating children's "running horse" cachexia, sores in the mouth and nose, broken and rotten teeth, when other medicines are ineffective:

Anshi's Prescription for Running Horse Cachexia:
For bleeding that doesn't stop in the teeth.
Burn silkworm's paper to ash.
Apply the ash to stop the bleeding; if using the tender part of the ground-bone bark, grind it into powder and apply to stop the bleeding completely.

Zeng's Salt Powder:
For treating running horse cachexia with rotten black-smelling teeth.
As many acorns as needed; usually, use two larger ones, fill with salt, and cover to form a package. You can also use five to ten smaller ones. Place them in the fire, roast with salt until cooked through, take them out, and place on the ground, covering with a pottery bowl to keep them. Wait until cool, then add a little musk, grind very finely in a mortar, and apply half a coin-sized amount to the affected area. Always store in a small pottery container, avoiding paper wrapping to prevent moisture.

Neijin Powder:
For foul, rotting black tissue at the tooth roots, with pain caused by worms.
Take chicken's inner golden skin (the rough skin inside the gizzard), dried, one tael; white angelica and copper green, each half a tael; a small amount of musk.
Grind the first three ingredients, or roast into powder and then combine with the musk in a mortar, grinding finely. Each time, use a small amount (or half a coin) for dry application to the affected area, first using warm salt water for gargling, then apply the medicine.[143p]

Huang Qi San: For treating kidney malnutrition with root rot symptoms.

Ingredients: Huang Qi (astragalus, honey-roasted), Niu Huang (cattle bile), Ren Shen (ginseng), Tian Ma (gastrodia), Quan Xie (whole scorpion, roasted), Xing Ren (apricot kernel, roasted), Bai Fu Ling (white poria), Chuan Dang Gui (Chinese angelica), Sheng Di Huang (raw rehmannia) washed in alcohol, Shu Di Huang (cooked rehmannia) washed in alcohol.

Mix the ingredients into a powder, take one qian (3.2 grams), or half a qian for smaller doses, decocted with Chen Men Dong (asparagus tuber) and warm water. Mai Men Dong (ophiopogon) can also be used.

Di Gu Pi San: For treating kidney malnutrition with symptoms of rotten, foul-smelling gums and teeth, with frequent bleeding.

Ingredients: Sheng Di Huang (raw rehmannia) half liang (15 grams), Di Gu Pi (lycium bark), Wu Bei Zi (gallnut, roasted until charred) two qian (6.4 grams), Xiao Xin (fine cinnamon) one qian (3.2 grams).

Grind the ingredients into a fine powder, and use a small amount to apply topically.

Lingyuan Antelope Horn Pill treats liver and lung heat stagnation, causing flesh growths in the eyes, red veins, and pain; also for red eye disease, eye pain, itching, and sensitivity to light; as well as for children's wind-damp conditions and inflammation of the eyes—it is remarkably effective.

Materials: Dried antelope horn shavings (1 tael), raw licorice (1 tael), white fleeceflower root (1 tael), and faeces of the pinellia plant, all washed in gauze to remove dirt; raw rehmannia (2 taels washed), turmeric roasted and used for cooling fire in the body (2 taels).

Combine the six ingredients, finely powdered and dried in the sun, then grind and sift into a fine powder. Refine with honey into pills the size of a phoenix seed. Take 15 pills with a strong brew of bamboo leaves and black bean soup, cold after meals and before sleeping. For children, make pills the size of a mung bean, taking 7 to 10 pills each dose.

Zhang Huan’s well-water stone powder treats eye wind and heat affecting the eyes, leading to progressive opacity and damage to vision.

Grind all ingredients into a fine powder, taking 1 qian with a bowl of rice wash water and a small amount of raw pig liver, simmering until the liver is well-cooked, serving warm at intervals after breast milk or food.[153p]

　　猪胆黄连散　治小儿疳瘦，大冶肝疳作眼疾，白膜遮睛，诸药不痊者。　　胡黄连　雄黄细研　夜明砂细研，各等分　猪胆数个　麝香少许，不入胆煮　　右为末，以猪胆汁调药，稀稠得所，却入原胆皮内，以线紧系口，米泔水煮五七沸，取出放冷。先以麝香于乳钵内研细，却入药一处同研，不用胆皮，只取出药，候细，用软饭为丸如麻子大，每服十丸，大者加至十五丸，米饮吞下。如疳气盛，须用陈米饮下。

Pig Gall and Coptis Powder treats children's malnutrition and weakness. For hepatic deficiency causing eye diseases, such as a white membrane covering the eyes, when other medicines have failed.

Huang Lian (Coptis chinensis), Xiong Huang (realgar) finely powdered, and Ye Ming Sha (night shining sand) finely powdered, in equal parts. Several pig gall bladders and a small amount of musk, not added to the gall during cooking.

Take the above as a powder, mix it with pig gall juice to the desired consistency, then place it back into the original gall bladder, tightly tying the opening with thread. Boil in rice wash water for five to seven boils, then take out and let cool. First, grind the musk finely in a mortar, then add the medicine and grind them together. Do not use the gall bladder; only take out the medicine and wait until finely ground. Use soft rice to form pills the size of sesame seeds. Take ten pills each time; for larger children, increase to fifteen pills, to be swallowed with rice drink. If the malabsorption is severe, it is necessary to use aged rice drink.

Jue Ming Powder treats children's liver wind-heat, with inability to see and perspiration.

Shi Jue Ming (Cassia seeds),乳香 (frankincense) each one portion, Dan Cao (thermopsis) two portions, and Da Huang (rhubarb) half a tael, prepared.

This is ground into powder; each dose is two qian (a unit of weight), taken with warm water mixed with mint. This formula is recommended in the sixteenth case of the Zhuang family.

Heat Clearing Pills stop yellowish and reddish diarrhea in children, as well as blood mixed with fish brain and anal ulcers, or worms growing from the anus.

Huang Lian (Coptis chinensis), Bi Pi (pulsatilla), Ku Shen (sophora), Gui Jiu (inula), Du Huo (angelica), Ju Pi (orange peel), Shao Yao (peony), and A Jiao (gelatin) each half a tael.

The eight ingredients are ground into powder, mixed with bluing juice and honey to form pills the size of small beans. Take five to ten pills daily. In winter, if bluing juice is unavailable, one can use a small amount of bluing seeds and mix with honey to create pills.[154p]

Ginger Honey Decoction: Treats dampness (hidden upper and lower parasites).
5 cups of ginger juice, 3 cups of white honey, 6 taels of yellow flower root.
Combine these three ingredients, separately boil the yellow flower root in 2 liters of water, strain to obtain 1 liter. Then add ginger and honey and further simmer to get 1.5 liters. For a 5-year-old child, take 4 cups on an empty stomach in the morning, twice daily.

Apricot Kernel Decoction: Treats (hidden upper and lower parasites).
50 apricot kernels, 2 liters of bitter wine, 1 cup of salt.
Combine these three ingredients, boil them together, and take 5 cups all at once. For children, adjust the dosage as needed.
Additionally, for treating parasitic erosion of the lower body:
Hu Fen and Xiong Huang: Mix these two ingredients in equal parts to a fine powder, apply in the grain channel. It is also suitable for children.

Zhang Huan's Peach White Powder: Treats deficiency in the intestines and stomach, movement of parasites in the abdomen, erosion of the lower body, and dampness (hidden upper and lower parasites).
1 tael of peach wood white bark, honey roasted yellow flower root, 1 tael of stir-fried yellow flower root with beard removed, 0.5 taels of cleaned snake skin ash, 1 fen of dried snail ash, 50 pitted Qingzhou dates, burned to ash.
Grind all these ingredients into a fine powder, then mix in 1 fen each of white powder and musk, each thoroughly blended. For each dose, take a character's worth mixed with gruel or drink before milk and meals.[155p]

Translation:

Like Holy Dan

Take seven toads, burn them to ash; take cicada shells, remove the soil; half a tael of the erlang snake toad, and big jujubes, remove the pits and burn to ash, one part each. Grind the above into fine powder, then use one part each of yellow dan, white powder, and musk, finely ground. Mix the items evenly, add a bowl of good vinegar, and pound for one to two hundred times until it forms a paste about the size of millet. Take five to seven grains with warm rice drink, adjusting the amount according to the child's size; or dissolve three to five grains and apply to the affected area. If the hidden worm surfaces, one will be cured.

Qian Yi's Jinhua Powder treats all pediatric damp sores and skin conditions. Half a tael each of huangbo and huanglian, ground into fine powder; one tael of yellow dan, one qian of fire-fly light powder, and a character of musk, ground separately. Mix evenly, first wash with warm water, then apply.

Hua (hidden worm) pills treat various intestinal worms, persistent crying, vomiting clear water, abdominal swelling and pain, purple-black lips and mouth, wet intestines (hidden worms). Equal parts of wuyin, aloe, qingdai, chuanxiong, baizhi stems, hu lian, chuan lian, and shrimp (worm ash) make up the powder. Soak pig bile into cake to make pills the size of sesame seeds. Take one to twenty pills after meals before lying down, accompanied by apricot kernel decoction. For the nose, often use bear bile decoction, dab with a small brush to wash, then after taking the previous medicine several times, use qingdai, danggui, red beans, gourd tips, diyu, huanglian, aloe, and realgar to make powder and apply inside the nose to contract sores.[156p]

Zhang Huan's Four Treasures Pill treats various forms of malnutrition, resulting in excessive thinness, with hair becoming dry and yellow, and sores appearing on the mouth and nose.

Take one large toad, remove its four legs, split open the abdomen, and place half a tael of Hu Huanglian inside. Sew it up with string, wrap it in three taels of damp paper, and cover it with mud on all sides. Use charcoal fire to heat it until it turns red, then let it cool and remove the mud to crush it into a fine powder. Take half a tael of aloe vera, grind it, and one split of musk, also ground. Mix all these ingredients evenly and grind them finely again, then combine with flour to form small pills the size of millet, taking five to seven pills at a time with congee, adjusting the dosage according to the child's size.

Additionally, for treating all forms of toxins and sores in children:

Take five jin of bitter neem bark, half a tael of lacquer tree leaves, two taels each of licorice and alum, and ten stalks of green onions. If the ailment is severe, two doses will be notably effective.[157p]

For treating children's malnutrition, with sores often appearing on the head that linger and do not heal, and for ear sores, all can be treated.

Ji Sheng Wan
Aloe, Five Spirit Resin, Calcined Night Bright Sand, Cardamom, Tangerine Peel, Sandalwood, Cooked Curcuma, and Kumquat flesh, each two qian.
For Huā Huàn (Bitter) use three qian of Chuanlian and Chuanqiang, and three qian of dried Toad Ash.
For Dang Gui and Qīng Pí, each one and a half qian.
If due to deficiency, add two qian of ginseng and three qian of white atractylodes, and omit cooked curcuma and green peel.
If due to heat, add three qian of gentian, omit cardamom and cooked curcuma.
If due to vomiting or diarrhea, add two qian of white atractylodes, and one and a half qian each of cooked meat fruit and myrrh, omitting green peel and cooked curcuma.
If due to accumulated pain, add two qian of cooked Sanleng, Chuanlian seed, and fennel, omitting Dang Gui and Chuanqiang.
If due to malaria, add three qian of tortoise shell vinegar-roasted.
If due to parasites, add one and a half qian of white mulberry and two qian of Chuanlian seed, omitting Dang Gui and Chuanqiang.
If due to thirst, add two qian of ginseng and white atractylodes, omitting cooked curcuma and cardamom.
Grind the above into a fine powder, mix with the bile of two male pigs to form pills, adjusting the size for consumption, taken with rice drink.[158p]

　　疳积散　治鬾乳，病乳，夹乳，夹食；大病之后，饮食失调；平居饮食过饱伤脾，致成疳积。面黄腹大，小便色如米泔，大便泻黄酸臭，头皮干枯，毛发焦穗，甚至目濇羞明，睛生云翳，形体骨立，夜热昼凉，丁奚哺露等证，并用主之。　　厚朴厚而紫色有油者佳，去粗皮切片，生姜自然汁炒熟为末净，一两　广陈皮去白为末，八钱　粉甘草去皮净为末　真芦荟净末，各七钱　芜荑真孔林大而多白衣者，去白衣壳净末，五钱　青黛取颜料铺浮碎如佛头青色者，研净末，三钱　百草霜乃山庄人家锅底墨也，净末，二钱，研　旋覆花净末，一钱半　　右件匀和成剂用，每一岁药一分，用灯心汤，早上空心时调服，服后病即愈。当再用肥儿丸调理。如脾气未实，用启脾丸或大健脾丸。如疳气未尽，用陈皮一两，白朮木香三钱，白茯苓五钱，加好平胃散三钱，陈米粥汤调服。[159p]

Gān Jī San

For treating conditions related to infantile malnutrition, such as impaired lactation, abnormal milk production, and improper feeding; after a severe illness with dietary mismanagement; and due to excessive eating harming the spleen, leading to malnutrition. Symptoms include a pale face, a distended abdomen, urination resembling rice wash, diarrhea that is yellow and foul-smelling, dry scalp, brittle hair, and even symptoms like photophobia, cloudy vision, emaciation, fever at night with chills during the day, and other related symptoms.

The formula includes:

  • Thick and oil-rich magnolia bark (best when it is dark purple, cut into slices without rough skin); 1 tael.
  • Dried tangerine peel, removing the white part and grinding to powder; 8 qian.
  • Sugar licorice, removing the skin and grinding to powder; 7 qian.
  • Real aloe, ground to powder; 7 qian.
  • True levisticum, large and many white coats, removing the white outer shell and grinding to powder; 5 qian.
  • Indigo, ground to powder, resulting in a color like the azure of a Buddhist statue; 3 qian.
  • Herbal frost (a type of cinders from a hearth), cleaned and powdered; 2 qian.
  • Xuan Fu flower, ground to powder; 1.5 qian.

Mix the above ingredients well to form a medicine. Each dose should be one part for every year of age, to be dissolved in lampwick tea and taken on an empty stomach in the morning. Healing is often immediate. If needed, follow up with Fei Er Wan to regulate the condition. If the spleen energy is not yet strong, use Qi Pi Wan or Da Jian Pi Wan. If symptoms of malnutrition persist, add 1 tael of dried tangerine peel, 3 qian of white atractylodes and wood fragrance, 5 qian of white poria, and adjust with 3 qian of Ping Wei San, consuming with congee made from aged rice.[159p]

　　麝香丸　主小儿疳瘦，面黄发穗，骨立减食，肌热惊癎疳虫。　　麝香研　芦荟研　黄连末[160p]

Divine Efficacy Pill treats children's malnutrition that cannot be cured.

Calcine green vitriol with fire until it turns red, then take it out and soak it in sour vinegar before calcining again. Repeat this process three times, then grind finely. Mix with jujube flesh to form pills the size of mung beans. Take them with warm water, two or three doses daily.

Musk Pill is for children who are emaciated, have a yellow complexion, prominent bones, decreased appetite, body heat, convulsions, and parasitic conditions. Ingredients: ground musk, ground aloe, and powdered rhubarb.[160p]

　　右等分研匀，滴水丸黄米大，一岁三丸，三岁五丸至七丸，人参汤下，日三服，无比奇效。一方：胡黄连四分，余二物各二分，疗疳痢温疟无比尤验，一名圣丸，疳药百数无如此者，小儿癫癎、惊风、五疳、三虫，服之立见功效。蛔虫作疾枯瘁，久痢不住，熟药调护，最难得法，惟以四味饮、散，紫圆，至圣散，五加皮治不能行，蜀脂饮，并此麝香圆七方，谓之育婴七宝。紫阳道士亦名保子七圣至宝方，专为一书者，此是也。

The above text describes various medicinal formulations for treating children's ailments, particularly related to malnutrition, worms, and other disturbances.

Here’s the English translation:

It is called the Holy Pill; there are countless remedies for malnutrition, but none comparable to this. For children's epilepsy, convulsions, malnutrition, and parasites, taking this shows immediate results. When roundworms cause illness leading to emaciation, or chronic dysentery persists, careful regulation with cooked medicine is difficult to achieve; the only effective methods involve a mix of four herbal drinks and powders, including Ziyuan and Zhisheng powder. The Shuzhi drink, and also this Musk Pill and seven formulas, collectively referred to as the Seven Treasures for Nurturing Infants. The Ziyang Daoist also calls it the Seven Sacred Treasures for Protecting Children, specifically for this book.

Adjust the number of pills according to the child's size, each swallowed with rice wine, taken twice a day, with common doses from three to five pills. According to the Zhang family tradition: pills should be the size of broad beans, divided into five parts, using vermilion, indigo, fragrant powder, and light ink, known as the Five-Color Pill, taken only at the right time, washed down with rice drink. According to the Kong family tradition: for treating malnutrition and heat-induced parasites, use fresh pig bile grease made into pills, dissolving in broth; pills should be the size of broad beans, taking ten to fifteen pills, washed down with meat broth. One qian of true copper sulfate, two taels of true green vitriol, both ground to a coarse powder.
Fourteen jujubes and one liter of good vinegar. Boil together until the jujubes are soft, then mix with the following medications:
Two taels of Quisqualis (remove shells), three taels of dried bitter orange (remove seeds and fry), one tael each of Coptis and black myrobalan (both ground to a coarse powder), seven pieces of Ba Dou (remove skins and crush).
Fry the above five ingredients together until blackened and about three parts dry, then add the following:
One tael of night-bright sand, one tael of dried shrimp (or bugweed) ash, half a tael of crushed neem root bark.
Fry the last three ingredients until dry, then combine with the previous four. Grind together, then pound in a mortar for a thousand strokes. If not forming properly, add soft jujube pulp, but do not add too much to avoid difficulty in digestion. If too thick, can be dilated with warm water as needed.[162p]

Treatment for all forms of malnutrition in children.

One toad head, roasted, with lard, powder of fermented beans, clove, and yellow gentian, each two and a half qian. Grind into a fine powder and form into pills the size of a hemp seed using soft rice. Take three pills each morning and evening with rice water.

Another recipe from the 17th notable work by the Zhuang family, using this formula alongside Xianglian pills: aloe, huanglian, cinnabar, indigo, and musk, each two and a half qian, with a small amount of toad venom. Grind into a fine powder, mix with rice to form pills the size of a mustard seed, and take five to seven pills on an empty stomach before bed with warm water.

The "Dingming Dan" passed down by Zhang Daoist from Hongzhou treats twelve types of malnutrition in children: liver malnutrition, acute malnutrition, wind malnutrition, flesh malnutrition, spinal malnutrition, mouth malnutrition, brain malnutrition, food malnutrition, roundworm malnutrition, spleen malnutrition, kidney malnutrition, and heart malnutrition, determining life and death. For those with these symptoms, if the worm is blue, death ensues; if yellow, it can be treated.

Ingredients: one-fifth qian of wood fragrance, night brightness sand, musk; three-fifths of cicada skin; two qian of huanglian; five sheets each of gold and silver foil. Grind into a fine powder, form into pills the size of hemp seeds, and take three pills on an empty stomach with rice water, three times a day. Avoid salty, sour, oily, and greasy foods.

Another recipe for the first type of liver malnutrition: although the child drinks milk, they gradually prefer meat, especially salty and sour foods. The treatment starts with Dingming Dan, followed by this medicine: three roasted nutmeg, seven and a half qian of stir-fried bitter orange peel, half a tael of white poria and huanglian, two qian each of rhubarb, licorice, clove, and musk. Grind into a fine powder and take one character worth with rice water, twice daily. For those with long-term issues, five doses are effective.[164p]

Yanshan's Medicinal Recipe for Children

Bétel Nut Pill:
For children who start eating meat too early, which harms the spleen and stomach, disrupting their ability to process food, causing accumulation and leading to ailments like malnutrition and diarrhea, this remedy is advisable.

Ingredients:

  • One nutmeg
  • One betel nut
  • Xuanlian
  • Hu Huanglian
  • Aged tangerine peel
  • Green tangerine peel
  • Fried Sichuan chuanlian flesh
  • Fried peeled wutou
  • Shenyang qu
  • Fried barley sprout
  • Wood fragrant
  • Yeming Sha, cleaned and fried
  • Aloe
  • Chuanxiong, each 3 grams
  • Musk, a single word

Grind the above into a fine powder, mix with wild boar gallbladder juice and mint juice to form pills the size of hemp seeds. Take 30 to 50 pills with warm rice porridge.

Hu Huanglian Pill:
This cures all types of malnutrition and various forms of diarrhea. Other medicines may not work; this medicine is extremely effective.

Ingredients:

  • Hu Huanglian
  • Aloe
  • Huanglian
  • Fried nutmeg
  • Cinnamon
  • Ginseng
  • Cinnabar
  • Ground walnut (huzi)
  • Wood fragrant
  • Gouteng (hook vine)
  • Dragon teeth
  • White poria, each 3 grams
  • Musk, a single word

Grind all the above as fine powder, take two wild boar gallbladders, extract the juice, mix it uniformly with the powder, put it into a bag, tie it with thread, and boil in water for half a day. Remove, cut the bag open, add 6 grams of stramonium seeds and 3 grams of yellow lead, grind separately into a powder, mix with the previous medicine, pound 500 times, and form into pills the size of broad beans. For malnutrition and diarrhea, take 5 to 7 pills with rice porridge. For young children, take 3 pills without rice porridge, let them suck from the nipple. This can treat twelve kinds of diarrhea and those without cause, with remarkable efficacy.[165p]

Wang's use of the "Shijunzi" herb treats damp heat.

The "Shijunzi" can be used in varying amounts, dried and ground into a powder, taken with hollow rice water. For larger children, use one qian, for smaller ones, half a qian, to expel worms as needed.

The Chaihu decoction treats bone-heat syndrome and dampness, with symptoms like great heat in the five hearts, worsening by the afternoon, dry mouth with no taste, excessive thirst, weight loss, chest fullness with phlegm, yellow urine, decreased appetite, and mental dullness. The ingredients are: northern Chaihu, ginseng, brown rice wine-washed Danggui, Huangqin, Chishaoyao, and honey-fried licorice, each one liang; fresh Dahuang and fried Jiegeng, northern Wuweizi, and Banxia, each half liang. For each dose, take two qian with one cup of water, one dried plum, two slices of ginger, and simmer down to two-thirds. Drink warm at any time.

The Dihuang decoction treats children's damp-heat deficiency, lung heat cough, gradual weight loss in the limbs, and dryness in the heart pulse. The ingredients are: fresh Dihuang juice five liang, butter, fresh ginger juice, and honey, each one liang; half liang of deer antler glue. First, add the Dihuang juice into a pot and simmer on low heat, stirring constantly. After about five or six boils, add the butter; after another five or six boils, add the honey, followed by the glue and ginger juice. Continue simmering until it reaches a thin syrup consistency, then stop the heat. Administer one spoonful after meals, twice a day, avoiding all toxic substances.[170p]

　　王先生鸡肉煎丸　治小儿十岁以上疳劳，壮热形瘦。　　宣连二两　银柴胡　秦艽　知母　使君子肉　子芩各一两　芜荑去衣　川鹤虱各半两　　右为末，以黄雄鸡一只，重一斤许，笼之，专以大麻子饲之，至五日后宰，去毛令净，于臀后开孔，去肠肚净，洗拭干，入药末于鸡腹内，以线缝之。取小甑，先以黑豆铺甑底厚三寸，安鸡在甑中，四旁以黑豆围裹，上亦以黑豆盖之，自日出蒸至晚，候温冷，取鸡，去腹中药及筋头翅，以净肉研匀和得所，如干入酒，面糊为丸如大麻子及小菉豆大。每服十丸、十五丸、二十丸，以意加减，空心临卧，麦门冬熟水吞下。如小儿疳劳骨热，十五岁以上，温酒下。忌猪肉。[171p]

Mr. Wang's Chicken Meat Pills treat malnutrition in children over ten years old, characterized by emaciation and intense fever.

Ingredients:

  • 2 liang of Xuanlian
  • 1 liang each of Yin Chaihu, Qin Jiao, Zhimu, and Shijunzhi flesh
  • 1 liang of Ziqin
  • 0.5 liang each of Wuyi (with skin removed) and Chuan Heshiz
  • Grind the above into powder.

Take a rooster weighing about one jin, house it, and feed it only hemp seeds for five days. After that, slaughter it, clean the feathers, make a small incision at the rear, remove the intestines, and wash thoroughly. Stuff the powdered medicine into the chicken's abdomen and sew it shut.

Prepare a small steamer, layer the bottom with three inches of black beans, place the chicken inside, surround it with black beans, and cover with more black beans. Steam it from sunrise to sunset. Once cooled, take the chicken and remove the internal medicine and tendons, blending the clean meat into a uniform mixture. Use dry wine to dilute it, forming pills the size of hemp seeds or small beans.

Take ten, fifteen, or twenty pills as needed, on an empty stomach before bedtime, swallowed with warm water. For children suffering from malnutrition and bone fever, those over fifteen can take with warm wine. Avoid pork.[171p]

　　张氏三和饮子　治三焦膈塞，五脏濇滞，气逆痰涎，米食后恶涎，太阳昏痛；及治山岚瘴气，吐逆，不美饮食，面色浮黄，指甲青黑；小儿疳劳吐乳；及久病乍安，神气未复，寒热往来，并皆救疗。　　紫圆人参三两半，洗銼　甘草一两半，炙銼　绵黄芪五两，酒浸一宿洗净銼　　右件三味，同入木臼内，用木杵捣为粗散，每服三大钱，生姜三片，水二盏，枣三枚，同煎八分，去滓服，不拘时候。
　　犀角散　治小儿骨热，解毒。
　　银柴胡　川大黄　甘草炙　川芎　茯苓　芍药　干葛　地骨皮　桑白皮　山栀仁　黄芩　贝母各半两　　右为末，每服一大钱，水一盏，入青蒿一枝，小麦十粒，煎七分，温温服之。大段有患，更入麻黄、连翘二味，与前药等分为末，煎服之，效。庄氏第二十一候用此方。

Zhang's Sanhe Drink

This remedy treats stagnation in the three jiao (upper, middle, and lower dantian), congestion of the five organs, rebellious qi and phlegm retention. It is effective for aversion to phlegm after eating rice, headache with a dull sensation, and for conditions caused by mountain miasma, nausea, poor appetite, pale yellow complexion, and dark blue-black nails. It is also applicable for children with malnutrition and vomiting of milk, as well as for those who have been ill for a long time and have just begun to recover, experiencing alternating chills and fevers.

Ingredients:

  • 3.5 taels of purple round ginseng, washed and ground
  • 1.5 taels of honey-fried licorice, roasted and ground
  • 5 taels of fine yellow astragalus, soaked in wine overnight, washed and ground

Combine these three ingredients in a wooden mortar and pound them into a coarse powder. Each dose is 3 large qian (a measure), along with 3 slices of fresh ginger, 2 cups of water, and 3 jujubes, decocted until reduced to two-thirds, then filtered and taken without regard to time.

Rhinoceros Horn Powder

This remedy is used for children with feverish bones and to detoxify.

Ingredients:

  • 0.5 taels each of silver bupleurum, Sichuan dandelion, roasted licorice, Sichuan chuanxiong, poria, peony, dry kudzu, earth bone bark, mulberry white skin, gardenia fruit, scutellaria, and fritillary bulb.

Grind these into a powder. Each dose consists of 1 large qian, mixed with 1 cup of water, adding a sprig of sweet wormwood and 10 grains of wheat, decocted until reduced to seven-tenths. Take it warm. For severe cases, add equal parts of ephedra and forsythia to the previous mixture, ground and decocted; it is effective. This formula is used by the Zhuang family for the twenty-first condition.

Wudan Pill: Treats children's thirst and malnutrition.
One each of pig bile, dog bile, cow bile, crucian carp bile, and hedgehog bile. Combine the bile juices with cow bile and hang it in the north of the stove. Wait until slightly dry, and then form into pills the size of millet. Take two pills with freshly drawn water each time, adjusting based on the child's thirst, and one dose on an empty stomach in the afternoon, modifying according to the child's size.

Huhuanglian Powder: Treats children's malnutrition, fever, thirst, and emaciation.
Two and a half qian of huhuanglian and rhinoceros horn shavings, one he of fresh root juice, half he of honey, and one whole lamb liver. Grind to extract juice. Half qian of musk, finely ground. Combine huhuanglian and rhinoceros horn, sieve to make powder, then mix in musk. Adjust the mixture with lamb liver juice, fresh root juice, and honey. Each dose is taken with a teaspoon of bamboo leaf decoction, adjusting based on the child’s size.

Huanglian Pill: Treats children's fever and thirst from malnutrition.
Finely grind huanglian, tianzhu yellow, cow bezoar, roasted licorice, gardenia seeds, wintersweet flower, kudzu root, purple aster, and rhinoceros horn shavings, each two and a half qian. Half a liang of chuanpuxiao and two he of bamboo juice. Grind and sieve the ingredients into powder, first mix with bamboo juice, then incorporate 熟蜜 (cooked honey) to form pills the size of mung beans. Take five pills crushed with fresh drawn water, four to five times a day, adjusting based on the child's size.[174p]

Zhuang's method for treating children's malnutrition and thirst:
Take a fresh catfish, apply powdered clam shell to the top, scrape off the saliva into the powder, grind it together, and form pills the size of a chickpea, taking one pill at a time. Also, use a live catfish, soak it in half a cup of water, mix the saliva with the water, and dissolve one pill immediately; then give one or two doses of a calming powder to supplement.

Another method for treating relentless malnutrition and thirst:
Take equal parts of well-water stone (also known as stone medicament), Taiyin essence stone, and horse tooth salt. Grind them into a powder, add a little raw sulfur, taking half a qian (weight unit) each time, dissolved in water from rinsed rice.

Jin family's inherited method:
Equal parts of dried kudzu, yellow coptis, roasted licorice, black ginseng, and ophiopogon, ground into a powder. Take one qian (weight unit) with half a cup of water and a slice of ginger, decoct for four minutes and consume.

Another method for treating children's malnutrition and thirst. Regular use prevents the five types of malnutrition:
Take two dried shrimp (or silkworms), scrape the abdomen clean with running water, and cook it in three sheng (volume unit) of liquor until fully soft, then remove the bones and grind it into powder. Use four liang (weight unit) of clean coptis, prepared separately into powder, and one and a half qian of realgar, along with one qian of musk, ground together. First, mix the shrimp paste and coptis powder, then combine with the musk and realgar, forming pills the size of a mung bean, taking ten pills at a time, washed down with old rice drink. If malnutrition occurs, use yellow wax tea to clear it. If hard to form pills, it is acceptable to mix with a bit of liquor to bind it.

Another method for treating all sorts of heat-induced thirst in children.[176p]

　　蚧虾(虫麻)大者，两枚　蜗牛虫半升，用水淘凈为度，然后用新瓦罐入二物在内，用盐泥固济，不得透风，更进火烧令通赤，候冷取出二物，不用罐子，入　大黄　黄连各半两　麝香二钱半　　右为末，面糊丸如芥子大，每服三丸至五丸，米饮下。庄氏第十六候用此方。　　又方　治小儿疳渴。

　　惠眼防己丸　治疳嗽不止。

Translation:

For large insects like the cicada shrimp (or worm), take two pieces, and half a sheng of snail insects. Clean them with water, then place them in a new ceramic pot, add the two items inside, using salt mud to seal it, ensuring no air can enter. Then apply heat to burn until it turns red, allow to cool, and take out the two items without using the pot. Add half a liang of rhubarb and Coptis, and two and a half qian of musk. Grind these into a fine powder and make into small pills the size of mustard seeds. Take three to five pills with rice wine. This method is used in the sixteenth situation by the Zhuang family.

Another recipe treats children's diarrhea and thirst:
Take two and a half qian each of ginseng, dried kudzu, Scutellaria, Bupleurum, and processed licorice. Grind them into a powder and take one qian with a cup of water. Boil for five minutes, strain, and cool. Divide into five doses, taking a dose each time and additionally mix with lead white frost and cold stone, ground into a fine powder to take as one dose. This is used to quell thirst in the twentieth situation by the Zhuang family.

Huiyan Fangji Pills treat persistent cough from malnourishment:
Take equal parts of Hanfangji, cowherb seeds, stir-fried Aristolochia, and sweet hemp. Grind into a powder, and make pills the size of small beans using boiled jujube meat. Take ten pills, wash down with glutinous rice wine, alternating with warming lung powder.[177p]

Warming Lung Powder
Guo Lou root, half a tael; licorice, roasted, two and a half qian.
Grind these into a powder; take one qian each time, mixed with honey and cooked water.

Apricot Kernel Powder
For treating children's lung ulcer, usually caused by consuming hot rice or spoiled milk, harming the heart and lungs, leading to wheezing and cough. Unwise doctors do not distinguish between hot and cold, attacking with medicine, resulting in yellow swelling and gradual lethargy. It is advised to take:
Fourteen apricot kernels, two qian each of licorice, (Herba) winter flower; one and a half qian of musk and Hu yellow vine. Soak with Ban Xia, nine times, half a tael.
Grind this into a powder; take one character each time, mixed with jujube soup, twice a day.

Niu Huang Pill
For treating children's digestive disorders (gan ji).
Xiong Huang powdered with water, Tian Zhu Huang, each two qian; Qian Niu powdered, one qian.
Grind these again, mix with flour to form pills the size of millet; take three to five pills each time, swallowed with mint tea after meals. Also treats digestive issues and accumulations. Regular use is beneficial. For larger children, increase the number of pills.

Zhang Huan's Brown Pills
For treating children with digestive distress and abdominal distention like a drum, as well as milk issues and food phobia.
One and a half liangs of Bu Zi, roasted; one liang of black Qian Niu, roasted; two and a half qian of pepper; Mu Xiang and E Zhu wrapped in damp paper and cooked, then sliced, each half a liang.
Grind these into a fine powder; mix with flour to form pills the size of millet; take twenty pills, boiled in Xian Ren Gu bone broth.[178p]

　　庄氏参苓散　治小儿因积成疳久，致脾胃虚弱，不思饮食。　　人参　茯苓　川芎各一两　甘草　芍药　黄芪各半两　青皮去白二钱半　　右为细末，每服一钱，水一小盏，煎至五分，去滓温服。

小儿诸疳门

　　　　方

　　香甲丸　治小儿积疳，潮热盗汗，羸瘦烦渴，手足心热，服之皆效，轻骨长肌。　　木香二钱五分　鳖甲去裙襕醋炙　槟榔　使君子肉　柴胡　黄连各半两　　右为末，豮猪脂汁和丸菉豆大，每服二十丸，临卧米饮下。久发潮热，多汗无力者，服之即效。[179p]

Transformative Elixir
One part millet, half a tael each of dried orange peel, green peel, and black morning glory; two and a half qian of depulped azuki beans. Fry these ingredients together until they turn dark yellow, remove the azuki beans, and add half a tael of aromatics ground to a fine powder. Shape into pills the size of millet grains, and take ten pills with orange peel decoction.

Zhuang's Ginseng and Poria Powder
For children suffering from chronic gastrointestinal accumulation leading to weak spleen and stomach, with no desire to eat. One tael each of ginseng, poria, and chuanxiong; half a tael each of licorice, peony, and astragalus; and two and a half qian of green peel, removing the white parts. Grind everything into a fine powder, take one qian with a small cup of water, decoct until reduced to one-fifth, strain, and take warm.

Xiangjia Pill
For treating children's accumulated illness, tidal fever, night sweats, emaciation, restlessness, and cold hands and feet. All symptoms resolve upon taking, promoting growth and nourishment. Two and a half qian of aromatics, vinegar-roasted tortoise shell (with skirt removed), half a tael each of areca nut, fruit of the quassi, chihou, and coptis. Grind into powder, mix with pig fat until moldable into pills the size of lentils; take twenty pills with rice drink before sleep. For persistent tidal fever, sweating, and weakness, taking this pill will yield immediate effect.[179p]

　　赵氏青蒿丸　疗小儿久积疳气，日渐羸瘦，面黄头发作穗，好食土，咬指甲捻鼻；兼治骨蒸劳热，及取疳虫，退诸脏横热。小儿常服，遍身香为效。　　槟榔一枚　白芜荑四十九个　黄连十四茎　夜明砂淘净，二钱半，已上为末　太阴元精石　麝香　小葱子炒　朱砂飞，各半钱　芦荟　天竺黄　青黛各一钱　　右将后七味同研细，与前四味一处再研匀，令极细，取青蒿自然汁慢火熬浓，仍用豮猪胆一枚取汁同捣，丸如粟大，每服五丸至七丸，并用米饮下，酽醋汤亦得。取疳虫，煎酸石榴汤下，二十服取尽虫。
　　五疳伤积方
　　芜荑　黄连各一两　使君子连壳，十四个　鹤虱少许　神曲半两　末之，猪胆调面糊为丸菉豆大，每服十丸，米饮下。
　　青金膏　治疳积。
　　青黛　朱砂　芦荟　蟾酥各一钱　麝香半钱　蜣螂一枚　蛇皮项后，四寸　　右末，水化酥丸粟大，每服两丸，倒流水送下；又水化一丸，注于鼻中，须臾眉上白虫出便安。青难治。[180p]

Zhao's Qinghao Pill: Treats children's chronic accumulation of phlegm and qi, progressively causing emaciation, pale complexion, hair resembling a tassel, desire to eat dirt, biting nails, and nose-picking; also treats heat from exhaustion and expels parasitic worms, alleviating internal heat. Regular use makes the child fragrant all over.

Ingredients:

  • One areca nut
  • Forty-nine white vulture seeds
  • Fourteen stems of rhizome coptis
  • Two and a half qian of washed night luminous sand
  • Taiyin essence stone
  • Musk
  • Stir-fried scallion seeds, half a qian each
  • Cinnabar, half a qian
  • Aloe vera, one qian
  • Indigo, one qian
  • Curcuma longa, one qian

Method: Grind the last seven ingredients finely, mix with the first four, grind until extremely fine. Slowly simmer the natural juice of Qinghao until thick, add juice from one pig’s gallbladder and pound together, forming pills the size of millet. Take five to seven pills each time, swallowed with rice drink or strong vinegar soup. To expel worms, brew sour pomegranate soup and take twenty doses to eliminate all worms.

Five Worms Accumulation Formula:

  • One tael each of vulture seeds and rhizome coptis
  • Fourteen whole seeds of quassia
  • A small amount of crane louse
  • Half a tael of shenqu
    Grind, mix with pig's gallbladder to form a dough-sized ball, take ten balls each time, swallowed with rice drink.

Qingjin Ointment: Treats phlegm accumulation.

Ingredients:

  • One qian each of indigo, cinnabar, aloe vera, toad venom
  • Half a qian of musk
  • One dung beetle
  • Four inches of snake skin

Method: Grind the above ingredients, dissolve the toad venom in water to form pills the size of millet. Take two pills, swallowed with running water; also dissolve a pill and inject it into the nose; after a short while, white worms will emerge from the forehead, resulting in relief. Qing is difficult to treat.[180p]

　　豆蔻散　治疳积或冷利，腹大脚小，身热，面无颜色。　　肉蔻二个　胡连一钱　使君子四枚　青黛　楝根　芜荑　厚朴姜汁炙　炙草各半两　麝香少许　夜明砂一钱半，别研　　右末，每服一钱或半钱，蜜水或粥饮调下。
　　知母散　治诸般疳积肚胀，无时泻痢，或时壮热，状如疟疾。　　知母　青皮焙干　柴胡各二钱　甘草炙　紫参各三钱　诃子肉煨熟，三枚　　右为细末，每服一钱，水五分，煎至三分，温服。有热则退，有痢则除，有结则通。
　　经验槟榔丸　治小儿疳病，积气成块，腹大有虫等证，其效如神。　　槟榔一两　三棱醋炙　莪朮醋炒　青皮麸炒　陈皮　雷丸　干漆炒烟尽　麦芽　神曲炒　山楂肉各半两　鹤虱炒　木香不见火　炙草　胡连各三钱　芜荑二钱半　良姜土炒，二钱　砂仁一钱　　右为细末，醋糊为丸如菉豆大，每服三五十丸，空心淡姜汤下。[181p]

Dou Kou San: Treats malnutrition-related accumulations or cold-related diarrhea, characterized by a large abdomen and small feet, body heat, and a pale complexion.
Ingredients: 2 grains of nutmeg, 1 qian of Indian borage, 4 seeds of quinine, blue indigo, root of the forest tree, mugwort, half a liang of ginger juice roasted, half a liang of roasted licorice, a small amount of musk, and 1.5 qian of night-bright sand, ground separately.
Usage: Take 1 qian or half a qian of the mixture, dissolved in honey water or porridge.

Zhi Mu San: Treats various types of malnutrition with abdominal swelling, diarrhea that occurs at times, or periodic fevers resembling malaria.
Ingredients: Zhi mu, dried green peel, 2 qian of each of Bupleurum and honey-fried licorice, 3 qian of purple ginseng, 3 cooked fruits of hezi.
Usage: Grind into a fine powder; take 1 qian with 5 fen of water, boil down to 3 fen, and take warm. It relieves heat, stops diarrhea, and clears blockages.

Jing Yan Bing Lang Wan: Treats children's malnutrition, with gas accumulation forming lumps, large abdomen, and presence of worms, with miraculous effects.
Ingredients: 1 liang of betel nut, vinegar-roasted three-sided needle, vinegar-fried curcuma, vinegar-fried green peel, aged tangerine peel, thunderbolt pill, smoke-baked lacquer, malt, fried shenqu, and hawthorn fruit, each half a liang; stir-fried herba diphylla, 3 qian; half a liang of the fried good ginger, 2 qian; and 1 qian of cardamom.
Usage: Grind into a fine powder, knead with vinegar to form pills the size of mung beans, take 30 to 50 pills with light ginger soup on an empty stomach.[181p]

　　粉霜丸　治小儿疳一切泻。
　　粉霜　白丁香各一钱　巴豆二枚，不出油　　右末，烂饭为丸如小菉豆大，每服井华水下二丸。
　　二圣丸　治小儿脏腑泻久不愈，羸瘦成疳，宜常服此方。　　川黄连　黄蘗去粗皮，各一两
　　右为细末，将药末入猪胆内，汤煮熟，丸如菉豆大，每服二三十丸，米饮下，量儿大小加减，频服无时。
　　胡黄连饮子　治小儿疳热，作泻少食，面黄体黑，日渐瘦悴。　　胡黄连　黄药子　人参　炙甘草　白朮微炒　秦艽　柴胡各等分　　右各味，用净(口父)咀，每服二钱匕，水一盏，嫩桃柳枝各七寸，乌梅少许，同煎八分，去滓分作两分，早食后少空一服，临卧再服，以小便深赤为验，候小便清住药，便生肌肤进食。大抵小儿羸瘦，并宜服此。[182p]

Powdered Frost Pill: Treats all types of diarrhea in children.

Ingredients: One qian each of powdered frost and white clove; two seeds of bitter apricot without oil. Grind into a fine powder, mix with boiled rice to form pills the size of small mung beans. Take two pills with well water each time.

Two Saint Pills: Treats persistent diarrhea in children’s organs leading to emaciation and malnutrition; suitable for regular use.

Ingredients: One liang each of Sichuan coptis and yellow coptis (with rough skin removed). Grind into a fine powder and place into pig bile, boil until cooked, then form pills the size of mung beans. Take two to thirty pills with rice drink, adjusting the amount based on the child's size; can be taken frequently at any time.

Huanglian Drink for Children: Treats heat and malnutrition in children, leading to decreased appetite, yellowish complexion, and emaciation over time.

Ingredients: Equal parts of huanglian (Chinese goldthread), huangyaozi (yellow drug), ginseng, roasted licorice, lightly fried baizhu (white atractylodes), qinjiao (gentian), and chaihu (bupleurum).

Preparation: Mix the herbs and chew thoroughly, then take two qian (measure) with one cup of water, adding seven inches of tender peach and willow branches, and a small amount of black plum. Boil down to eight parts, strain, and divide into two doses. Take one dose after breakfast with a little fasting, and the other before bed.

Monitor the child’s urine; it should be deep red at first, then clear as they respond to treatment and gain weight. Generally, emaciated children should also take this remedy.[182p]

　　黄连丸　治疳泻疳痢。
　　净黄连为末　大芜荑仁乳钵研细，各等分　　右二末一处和匀，糯粟米相和，煮稀粥为丸小菉豆大，量儿大小，三岁七丸至十丸，三岁以上十五丸至二十丸，空心陈米饮下，日进三服。
　　胡黄连丸　治小儿疳疾泻痢。
　　胡黄连　丁香　密陀僧各半两　肉豆蔻一个　槟榔一枚　红雪一两　诃子二枚，一煨一生用　　右七味研细，入麝香二钱半和匀，入菉豆末少许，水和丸如麻子大，三岁以下一丸，三岁以上五丸。孩子脑疳、鼻痒及赤烂，黄连汤下。脾虚羸瘦，泄痢，四肢虚肿，青州枣汤下。肝疳眼濇生疮，甘草汤下。骨疳冷地卧，爱食土，紫苏茶汤下，常服米饮下。肺疳上气急喘，橘皮汤下。筋疳泻血，盐汤下。疳虫及泻无定，生姜汤下。[183p]

Huanglian Pill: Treats malnutrition-related diarrhea and dysentery.
Ground pure Huanglian into powder, finely grind equal parts of Dahuang, Lianzi, and mix the two powders together. Combine with glutinous millet to cook into a thin porridge, then form into small pills the size of mung beans, based on the child's size. For children aged three, give seven to ten pills; for those over three, give fifteen to twenty pills. Take on an empty stomach with aged rice water, three doses per day.

Huhuanglian Pill: Treats malnutrition-related diarrhea and dysentery in children.
Use half a liang of Huhuanglian, cloves, and Mithridatum, one piece of nutmeg, one betel nut, one liang of red snow, and two myrobalans (one slow-cooked, one fresh). Grind these seven ingredients finely and mix with two and a half qian of musk, adding a little mung bean powder and forming into pills the size of sesame seeds. For children under three, give one pill; for those over three, give five pills. For children with malnutrition-related conditions such as itchy scalp and red sores, administer Huanglian decoction. For those with spleen deficiency and thinness, experiencing diarrhea, give Qingzhou jujube decoction. For liver-related symptoms like eye sores, give licorice decoction. For bone-related cold symptoms and cravings for earth, give purple perilla tea. For lung-related issues with urgent breathing and wheezing, give tangerine peel decoction. For dysentery with blood, give saline water. For malnutrition worms and unstable diarrhea, give ginger decoction.[183p]

　　钱氏没石子丸　治泄泻白浊，及疳痢滑儿腹痛者。　　木香　黄连各二钱半　没石子　豆蔻各二个　诃子肉三个　　右为细末，饭丸麻子大，米饮下食前，量儿加减。
　　聚宝黄龙丸　定小儿疳冷泻。
　　朱砂研，一钱　龙脑半字，研　舶硫黄一两　雄黄二钱半　　右用甘锅子，上炭火，烧甘锅，其药飞在盏底上，刮与珠砂、雄黄同研，入脑子，糯米粥丸如黄米大，每服三丸，食前椒汤下。
　　吉氏芦荟丸　治疳泻不止，不思饮食腹胀。　　丁香　肉豆蔻去皮　木香銼，各半两　　右三味，用面裹，慢火中煨熟为度，取出去面，入芦荟一两、使君子肉半两，同为细末，稀糊为丸如黍米大，每服十丸至二十丸，米饮下。[184p]

Qian's Mo Stone Pill treats diarrhea with white turbidity, as well as abdominal pain in children caused by malnutrition and dysentery.

  • 2.5 qian each of wood fragrance and yellow lotus
  • 2 pieces of Mo Stone and cardamom
  • 3 pieces of myrobalan fruit

Grind the above into a fine powder, make into pills the size of a sesame seed, and take with rice drink before meals, adjusting the quantity for children.

Jubao Huanglong Pill is effective for treating cold diarrhea in children.

  • 1 qian of ground cinnabar
  • Half a character of dragon brain
  • 1 liang of ship-sourced sulfur
  • 2.5 qian of realgar

Use a sweet pot over charcoal to heat the sweet pot, allowing the medicine to fly to the bottom of the cup. Scrape and grind it together with the cinnabar and realgar, then add the dragon brain. Form into pills the size of yellow millet with glutinous rice porridge, taking three pills each time, with pepper soup before meals.

Ji's Aloe Pill is for treating persistent diarrhea due to malnutrition, with loss of appetite and abdominal bloating.

  • Half a liang each of cloves and peeled nutmeg
  • Half a liang of wood fragrance, grated

Combine these three ingredients, wrap in flour, and simmer on low heat until cooked. After removing the flour, add 1 liang of aloe and half a liang of quino fruit, and grind into a fine powder, making into pills the size of glutinous millet. Take 10 to 20 pills with rice drink.[184p]

　　良方吴婆散　治小儿疳泻不止，日夜不计遍数，渐渐羸瘦。　　楝根白皮一钱半　桃根白皮　黄蘗蜜炙　芜荑　黄连微炒，已上各二钱半　厚朴姜汁炙　木香　槟榔　丁香各一钱　没石子一钱半　　右为末，每服一字，三岁以上半钱，五六岁一钱，用紫苏木瓜米饮调下，乳食前一日三服。张三锡曰：此药若是疳泻，无不验者。药性小温，暴热泻者，或不相当。
　　斗门方　治小儿疳泻。
　　赤石脂
　　右杵罗为末，极细如面，以粥饮调半钱服立瘥。或以京芎等分同服，更妙。
　　庄氏家传方　治疳泻久不瘥。
　　赤石脂　绿矾　石灰各二两　硫黄半两　　右研匀，入罐子内，烧令焰碧，去火放冷，取研，每服一字或半钱，煎小黄米饮放冷调下，食前服。　　又方[185p]

Liang Fang Wu Po San
Treats persistent diarrhea in children, resulting in gradual emaciation day and night without count.
Ingredients:

  • 1.5 qian of white root bark of the tree of heaven
  • 2.5 qian each of white root bark of peach, honeyed coptis, and herbal gall
  • 2.5 qian of finely ground wo herb
  • Slightly fried Huanglian
  • 1 qian each of roasted houpu, ginger juice, muxiang (costus), betel nut, and clove
  • 1.5 qian of bezoar stone

Grind all these into a powder. For each dose:

  • For children over three years old: 0.5 qian
  • For five to six years old: 1 qian

Mix with flavored sorrel, papaya, and rice drink and take before milk or food, three times a day. Zhang Sanxi says: This medicine is effective against diarrhea without exception. Its properties are slightly warm; it may not suit those with violent heat diarrhea.

Doumen Fang
Treats children's persistent diarrhea.

  • Chi Shizhi (red stone fat)

Grind the above into an extremely fine powder as fine as flour. Mix with porridge for a half qian dose and it will heal immediately. Alternatively, mixing with京芎 (jing qiong) in equal parts is even better.

Zhuang's Family Prescription
Treats prolonged diarrhea.

  • 2 liang each of Chi Shizhi, green vitriol, and lime
  • 0.5 liang of sulfur

Grind these uniformly, place in a jar, burn until it turns blue, then remove from fire and let cool, grind again. For each dose: 1 character or 0.5 qian, decoct with cooled small yellow rice drink and take before eating.[185p]

　　便君子炮　五倍子瓦上炒黄　没石子各等分　　右为末，每服半钱，陈米饮调下。

　　孟诜方　疗小儿疳痢。
　　樗木根取白皮一握　仓梗米五十粒　豉二合　炙草二寸　葱白一握　　右以水一升，煮取半升，以意服。枝叶与皮勿用。
　　青黛散　治小儿疳痢不止，下部痒。　　青黛　蟾灰　胡粉微炒　黄连去须微炒　麝研，各二钱半　赤石脂半两　诃梨勒皮一两，煨　　右件捣罗为散，每以乳汁调下半钱，日三四服。
　　杀疳丸　治疳痢不止。
　　雄黄　麝香　牛黄　芦荟　朱砂各研细　龙骨烧赤　密陀僧烧红　胡黄连各二钱半　青黛半两　金箔十片　肉豆蔻二枚，去壳　蟾酥一钱二分半，热水化如泥　　右件药捣罗为末，入研药及蟾酥，研令匀，汤浸蒸饼和丸如黄米大，每以温水下三丸；煎黄连苦参汤洗身上，用青衣盖出虫瘥。
　　白龙骨丸　治疳痢不止。[186p]

Bian Junzi Pao
Five substances: roasted gallnut on a tile to a yellow color, mixed with equal parts of stone. Grind this into a powder; take half a cash with aged rice drink.

Meng Shen's Formula
For treating children's dysentery.
Take a handful of the white bark of the Chinese ash root, fifty grains of wheat, two portions of fermented soybeans, two inches of roasted licorice, a handful of green onion tops. With one liter of water, boil down to half a liter and drink as needed. Do not use branches or leaves.

Qingdai Powder
For treating persistent dysentery in children, with itchy lower parts.
Qingdai, toad ash, slightly roasted powdered herbs, Huanglian (with roots removed, slightly roasted), and musked each to two and a half qian. Half a liang of red stone resin and one liang of dried fruit peel (He-ling) to be cooked.
Grind this into a powder; each dose mixed with milk juice, half a cash, taken three to four times a day.

Killing Dysentery Pill
For treating persistent dysentery.
Finely ground: realgar, musk, beef gall, aloe, and cinnabar; burned dragon bone, red burnt mistletoe, each two and a half qian. Half a liang of qingdai, ten pieces of gold leaf, two nutmeg seeds (shelled), and one and a half qian of toad toxin, dissolved in hot water to a paste.
Grind and mix these medications with toad toxin, and make into balls the size of yellow millet, taken three pills with warm water; boil Huanglian and Ku Shen decoction to wash the body, covering with green garments to expel worms.

White Dragon Bone Pill
For treating persistent dysentery.[186p]

　　白龙骨　白石脂　矾烧令汁尽　黄连微炒　胡粉微炒　白茯苓　阿胶捣碎炒黄，各半两　　右为末，炼蜜圆麻子大，每粥饮下五丸，日三四服。
　　肉豆蔻丸　治小儿疳痢，不吃乳食。四肢瘦弱。　　内蔻去壳一枚　木香半两　人参　诃子肉煨　朱砂　麝香并细研，各二钱半　　右捣罗为末，都研令匀，用软饮和丸如麻子大，每服以米饮化下三丸，日三四服，量儿加减。
　　圣惠黄连散　治小儿疳痢久不瘥，肌肉消瘦，面黄发焦，啼叫不常。　　胡黄连末　白矾烧令汁尽　白龙骨末，各半两　胡粉微炒，二钱半　　右件药同细研为散，一岁儿每服以米饮调下一字，二岁每服半钱，随儿大小，量病轻重加减。
　　芜荑丸　治小儿久疳痢不瘥。
　　芜荑末，半两　羊子肝一具
　　右先以子肝切作片子，以芜荑末掺在肝内，线缠合，米泔中煮令熟，捣烂，糯米饭和丸如麻子大，每以粥饮下五丸，早晨晚后各一服，量儿加减。[187p]

White Dragon Bone: White resin, burnt alum until the juice is gone; slightly fried yellow sulfur, slightly fried white Poria, and crushed and lightly fried donkey-hide gelatin, each half a tael. Mix these into a fine powder, then refine with honey into balls the size of hemp seeds. Take five balls daily, three to four times.

Nutmeg Pill: Treats children's malnutrition and dysentery, not eating dairy or food. Weak limbs. One piece of cardamom (remove the shell), half a tael of agarwood, ginseng, cooked chebulic myrobalan pulp, cinnabar, and musk, each two and a half qian. Grind these into a fine powder, mix evenly, and form small balls the size of hemp seeds with soft drink. Take three balls daily, dissolving in rice drink, three to four times, adjusting based on the child's age.

Holy Beneficial Huanglian Powder: For children with prolonged dysentery that doesn't heal, muscle wastage, pale face, and sporadic crying. Ground huanglian, white alum (burnt until juice is gone), fine powdered white dragon bone, each half a tael; slightly fried hu powder, two and a half qian. Grind these together into a powder. For a one-year-old, take one word proportion with rice drink; for a two-year-old, half a qian per dose, adjusting according to the child's size and the severity of the illness.

Wuju Pill: Treats prolonged dysentery in children. Half a tael of wuju powder, one sheep's gallbladder. First, slice the gallbladder, mix with the wuju powder inside, tie with string, and boil in rice wash until cooked. Mash, mix with glutinous rice to form pills the size of hemp seeds. Take five pills with porridge, one dose in the morning and one dose at night, adjusting based on the child.[187p]

Eight Fragrant Pills: This is the first remedy of the Zhuang family, used for purging pus and blood, addressing diminishing health day by day. It is suitable for cases of mixed hot and cold dysentery. Take this medicine.

Ingredients:

  • 1 qian of smoked pepper
  • 0.5 qian each of brain and musk
  • 1.25 qian of buffalo ox bile
  • 1.5 qian of aloe
  • 5 fingers of toad venom, made into blocks as needed
  • 0.5 liang of white-flowered snake, soaked in wine and deboned
  • 2.5 qian of scorpion tails

Grind the above into a fine powder, form into pills the size of millet. Take five pills at a time with rice drink. If the condition is severe, use raw rice wash mixed, take half a qian as a powder three times daily.

  • 0.5 liang of roasted tangerine peel, hu huanglian, and angelica

Agarwood Pills: For treating children’s dysentery, passing red pus and blood, with prolapse of the rectum.

  • 2 fen each of dragon bone and licorice

White Atractylodes Powder: For treating children’s dysentery with abdominal distension and pain, causing frequent bowel movements day and night, up to twenty.

Ingredients:

  • 1 liang of lightly roasted white atractylodes

Grind the above into coarse powder, take one qian with one small cup of water, simmer until it reduces to one-fifth, strain, and adjust according to the child's size.[188p]

Huanglian Pills treat children's dysentery and persistent abdominal pain.

Swelling formula treats children's five types of dysentery, with symptoms such as yellowing, abdominal swelling, thin limbs, visible veins on the abdomen, eye watering, nasal discharge reaching the mouth, biting nails, lesions in the lower region, and difficulty urinating or defecating.

Ingredients:

  • One fen of Aloe
  • One fen of pan-fried Ye Ming Sha
  • One fen of snake bile ash
  • One fen of cattle horn shavings
  • A small amount of toad venom

Grind these to a powder, mix with a little musk, and make pills the size of mung beans. Take three pills with rice alcohol. Occasionally use a decoction of peach and willow leaves to bathe the child, cover them with a blue garment, and apply one or two pills to the child's navel, sticking it with a mixture of vinegar and flour on a blue silk cloth, waiting for worms to emerge. If there are no worms, sweating is a good sign. Reduce the dosage by one pill after three days of medication.

Another formula treats children's dyspepsia and abdominal swelling, resembling water retention.

The Ji family's traditional prescription treats indigestion and abdominal swelling.

For this, mix one qian each of Mithradates' powder and wind-processed ash, and half a qian of yellow lead. Grind this mixture, and dip a slice of pig meat in half a qian of the medicine to give to the child. If the child cannot eat it, have a wet nurse chew it for them.

The Imperial Garden's Harmonizing Qi Powder addresses reverse qi in the spleen and lungs, symptoms like wheezing, coughing, facial bloating, chest fullness and discomfort, and difficulty urinating. Use two liang of mulberry white bark, one and a half liang of aged tangerine peel, one liang each of stir-fried balloon flower root, honey-fried licorice, and red poria, and four liang of wood clematis, boiled in ginger water for consumption.

The Black Gold Ointment treats children's indigestion and gas with a yellowish tint. Use two and a half qian each of reed root, yellow skin, and rhubarb, burn them to retain their essence, grind to a powder. For each use, take one qian, mix with pig bile to form an ointment, and apply it. If symptoms persist, wash with snake bed seed decoction, then apply again.

The Rehmannia Pill treats kidney-related heat leading to emaciation, cold hands and feet, alternating chills and fever, slippery diarrhea, swollen abdomen, decayed gums, dark nails, and skin sores producing water. Chongyue Formula (from “Wai Yi Xiaopin”) treats four to five-year-old children suffering from heat due to improper diet or from maternal consumption of coarse, spicy foods, affecting milk production, leading to poor nourishment for the child, abdominal fullness, and thinness. Cucumber Pills
Used to treat children who are thin and overheated, with little intake of milk and food.
One large cucumber, dried tangerine peel, and half a tael of each of the following: Coptis, tortoise shell soaked in three nights of urine and then roasted yellow, and Hu Lian. One tael of Chai Hu.
The above ingredients are finely powdered and sifted into a powder. Cut the cucumber open, remove the pulp, and fill it with the powdered herbs, then cover it with the top piece. Using fragrant wheat flour mixed and pounded into a dough of about three-tenths of an inch thick, roast until the surface is golden brown over sugar ash fire. Remove the dough and let it cool. Add one qian of musk and grind together into balls the size of a mung bean. Take seven pills before meals with rice water.

Rhubarb Pills
Used to treat children with unbalanced stomach qi, who do not have an appetite and do not gain muscle.
Three qian each of the following: Rhubarb, dried rehmannia, poria, angelica, Chai Hu, and apricot kernels.
Grind them into powder, form into honey pills the size of a sesame seed, and take five pills with water, three times a day.

Pig Stomach Pills
Relieves children's muscle heat, occasional diarrhea, stagnation, and loss of appetite, leading to weight loss.
One tael of tortoise shell, combined with children's urine and vinegar, heated and soaked until complete.
One tael each of white atractylodes and yam, half a tael each of Coptis, ginseng, green tangerine peel, purple aster, peeled and pointed peach kernels, musk, and roasted licorice, and one tael of Chai Hu.
Grind the above ingredients into powder, place it inside a clean pig stomach, securely tied, and boil until completely tender. Pound together with the medicine until sticky, forming pills the size of a tung seed. Take twenty pills at a time, regardless of the hour, with warm water.[193p]
