Xiang Jia Wan: Treats the symptoms of young boys and girls with deficient qi and blood, resulting in emaciation, joint pain, feverish chills, restlessness, cold limbs, loss of appetite, and bloated sensation due to qi stagnation. It strengthens the spleen and stomach, promotes the spirit and qi, nourishes the skin, and enhances complexion.

Ingredients:

  • Chai Hu
  • Sheng Gan Di Huang
  • San Leng, each 3 fen
  • Bie Jia (yellow and vinegar roasted)
  • Shen Qu
  • Xing Ren
  • Shou Gan Di Huang
  • Mai Ya (fried), each 1 liang
  • Niu Xi
  • Mu Xiang
  • Jiang Huang
  • Dang Gui, each 0.5 liang
  • Bai Zhu
  • Chuan Xiong, each 1 fen

Prepare into a fine powder. Form into pills the size of a wutong seed; take 10 pills with warm tea on an empty stomach, or with rice drink if preferred. This formula is suitable for those with heat symptoms.

Sheng Hui He Li Le San: Treats emaciated children with weak spleen and stomach qi, excessive food retention, poor appetite, and disharmony in the limbs.

Ingredients:

  • He Li Le Pi
  • Chen Ju Pi (dried tangerine peel), each 0.5 liang
  • Huang Qi
  • Ren Shen
  • Bai Zhu
  • Huo Xiang
  • Gui Xin
  • Bai Fu Ling, each 1 fen
  • Zhi Cao, 0.5 fen

Crush the ingredients into a coarse powder; take 1 qian with a small cup of water, adding a little fresh ginger and one jujube. Boil until reduced to one-fifth, then strain and take warm, three to four times a day, adjusting dosage according to the child's size and needs.[194p]

　　温脾散　治小儿脾气不和，食少无力，肌肤羸瘦。　　诃梨勒皮　人参各三分　白朮　木香　黄芪　白茯苓　藿香　陈橘皮焙　桔梗各半两　炙草一分　　右件药捣粗罗为散，每服一钱，以水一小盏，入生姜少许，枣一枚，煎至五分，去滓，不计时候温服。
　　五香煎　治小儿脾胃久虚，吃食减少，四肢羸瘦。　　丁香　沉香　木香　藿香　白朮各一两　麝三钱　白茯苓　陈橘皮焙　黄芪各一两　诃梨勒皮　炙草半两　　右件药捣筛为散，以水五升，慢火煎至一升，以布绞汁入锅内，煎麝香及蜜三合、生姜汁半合、枣肉二十枚，慢火熬成膏，每服以粥饮调下半茶匙。　　右三方，挟冷者宜之。[195p]

Wen Pi San is used to treat children's spleen qi disharmony, resulting in reduced appetite and weakness, with emaciated skin.
Ingredients:

  • He Li Le peel 3 fen
  • Ginseng 3 fen
  • Bai Zhu ½ liang
  • Mu Xiang ½ liang
  • Huang Qi ½ liang
  • Bai Fu Ling ½ liang
  • Huo Xiang ½ liang
  • Chen Ju Pi (roasted) ½ liang
  • Jie Geng ½ liang
  • Zhi Cao 1 fen

Crush the above ingredients into a coarse powder. Each dose consists of 1 qian, boiled with a small cup of water, a little fresh ginger, and one jujube, simmered until reduced to ½ cup. Strain and drink warm at any time.

Wu Xiang Jian treats prolonged deficiency of spleen and stomach in children, leading to decreased food intake and emaciated limbs.
Ingredients:

  • Ding Xiang 1 liang
  • Chen Xiang 1 liang
  • Mu Xiang 1 liang
  • Huo Xiang 1 liang
  • Bai Zhu 1 liang
  • She Xiang 3 qian
  • Bai Fu Ling 1 liang
  • Chen Ju Pi (roasted) 1 liang
  • Huang Qi 1 liang
  • He Li Le peel ½ liang
  • Zhi Cao ½ liang

Crush and sift the above ingredients into a powder. Boil with 5 sheng of water on low heat until reduced to 1 sheng. Strain the juice into a pot, then simmer with She Xiang and 3 he of honey, half a he of ginger juice, and 20 pieces of jujube flesh, until it becomes a paste. Each dose should be taken with half a teaspoon mixed in congee.

The above three formulas are suitable for those with cold symptoms.[195p]

　　芦荟丸　汤氏云：小儿疳积，其状渐黄瘦，拍背如鼓鸣，脊骨如锯，乃积而成热成疳也，宜服此。　　芜荑去皮，先炒黄色，次入后二味一处炒赤色　龙胆草　黄连各一两　　右为末，另入芦荟一分和匀，烂饭丸如黍米大，二岁儿服三十丸，空心米饮送下。
　　露星膏
　　黄芪蜜水炙　胡黄连　地骨皮　柴胡各等分　　右为末，炼蜜丸如芡实大，隔宿酒浸露一宿，次日澄去酒，薄荷汤浸服之。
　　二圣丸　治小儿脏腑或好或泻，久不愈。羸瘦宜常服。　　黄连　黄蘗去粗皮，各一两
　　右为细末，入猪胆内，重汤煮熟，丸如菉豆大，每服二三十丸，米饮下，量儿加减，频服无妨。[196p]

Aloe Pills: According to the Tang family, in children with intestinal accumulation, the condition gradually shows yellowing and emaciation, with a drum-like sound when the back is tapped, and the spine resembling a saw. This is due to accumulation leading to heat and malady, thus this should be taken.

Remove the skin from the herb "Wuyin," first stir-fry until yellow, then add two other ingredients and stir-fry until red: Longdan (Gentian) and Huanglian (Coptis), each one tael. Grind into powder and mix with one part Aloe, then form into pills the size of millet. For a two-year-old child, administer thirty pills, washed down with a drink made of hollow rice.

Lustrous Star Ointment: Huangqi (Astragalus), honey, and water, mixed with Hu Huanglian (Coptis), Digupi (Radix Rehmanniae), and Chaihu (Bupleurum), all in equal parts. Grind into powder, refine with honey into pills the size of water chestnuts. Soak in wine overnight, then the next day, strain off the wine and take with mint tea.

Ersheng Pills: Used to treat children's internal organs either for overactive or constipated conditions that persist without improvement, particularly for those who are emaciated, this should be taken regularly. Huanglian and Hu Huangbò (Phellodendron) peeled of rough skin, each one tael. Grind into fine powder and place in pig bile, boil until cooked, then form pills the size of mung beans. Each dose should be two to thirty pills, taken with rice drink; adjust the quantity for the child, and frequent usage is not harmful.[196p]

　　香蟾丹　治肌瘦面黄，胸高脚细。
　　干蟾五枚，浸去骨，用瓦藏瓶一枚，入蟾瓶内，盐泥固济，炭火烧，留一窍子，以烟息为度，取出存性　胡黄连二两　蛇蜕一两，烧灰　地龙半两，微炒　天竺黄　蝉壳各一分，并为细末，入　朱砂半两　麝香一分　　右件都一处研匀，糯米饭和如黍米大，每服十粒，米饮下，不拘时候，量儿大小加减。
　　雷丸丹　万全云：治小儿一切疳，肚大脚细，眼目口鼻生疮，身体壮热，痢下泔淀，日渐羸瘦，面无光泽。　　生雷丸　土鹤虱　生史君子去壳　胡黄连　芦荟各半两　蟾一枚，酒浸炙热去皮足骨焙　木香　肉豆蔻各一分　芜荑一两，微炒，研入　朱砂二钱，研留少许为衣　麝香半钱　　右为末，研合令匀，用豮猪胆一个，取汁倾入瓷盏中，外以重汤煮过，和杵为丸如桐子大，每服五丸至七丸，麦门冬熟水下，早晨日午空心临卧服。[197p]

Fragrant Toad Pill: Treats thin skin and yellow face, prominent chest and thin feet. Take five dried toads, soak to remove bones. Use a clay bottle to store, place the toads inside, seal with salt mud, and roast over charcoal fire, leaving a small opening to let out the smoke. Remove after setting.

Use two taels of hu huang lian (yellow gentian) and one tael of snake skin, burn to ash. Half a tael of earth dragon, lightly fry. Use one fen each of tian zhu huang (bitter gourd) and cicada shells, grind to fine powder. Add half a tael of red mercury and one fen of musk. Mix everything well and combine with glutinous rice to make pills the size of millet. Take ten pills with rice wine at any time, adjusting the dosage for children based on size.

Thunder Pill: Wanquan says: Treats all forms of child's malnutrition, with big belly and thin feet, ulcers around the eyes, mouth, and nose, strong body heat, and loose stools, progressively losing weight and lacking luster.

Use raw thunder pills, half a tael of earth cicada, shelled raw shi junzi (buckwheat), hu huang lian, and aloe each. One toad, soaked in wine and roasted, remove skin and bones. One fen each of wood fragrance and nutmeg. One tael of wuyizi (wild seed), lightly fry, then grind into powder, adding two qian of red mercury and set aside a little for coating. Use half a qian of musk. Grind these ingredients together until uniform, using the bile from a black pig to extract the juice, pour into a porcelain cup, and steam with heavy broth. Form into pills the size of tung seeds, taking five to seven pills with cooked water from mai-men-dong (asparagus) on an empty stomach in the morning and afternoon.[197p]

　　孔氏神圣丸　治小儿疳，常服永无肠脏之疾。　　胡黄连　宣连　白芜荑　木香　芦荟各一钱　使君子二十枚　　右除芦荟一味，外五味银器内用猪胆汁熬成膏，后入芦荟，同丸如菉豆大，每服五七粒，空心日午临卧米汤下，神效。
　　猪肚丸　治小儿疳热而瘦。
　　芜荑二两，同瓦煿干取肉，别为末，临时入用　柴胡　黄连　秦艽各一两　　右用猪肚一个，中庸者，破开洗净，入柴胡、秦艽、黄连末于内，以酒半瓶、童便一升煮干，舂令得所，放芜荑末，又舂匀，丸如桐子大，每服二十丸饮下。[198p]

Kong's Sacred Pill treats childhood malnutrition, with regular use relieving bowel ailments for a lifetime. Ingredients include: Hu Huang Lian, Xuan Lian, Bai Wu Yi, Mu Xiang, and each one qian; twenty pieces of Shi Jun Zi. Exclude the Aloe, and use the other five ingredients to boil with pig bile in silver utensils until it becomes a paste, then add the Aloe. Form into pills the size of mung beans. Take five to seven pills on an empty stomach at noon, washed down with rice soup for effective results.

Pig Stomach Pills treat children with heat-related malnutrition and waste. Two liang of Wu Yi, dried and minced from tiles, and set aside separately. One liang each of Chai Hu, Huang Lian, and Qin Jiao. Use one medium-sized pig stomach, clean it, and fill it with minced Chai Hu, Qin Jiao, and Huang Lian, then add half a bottle of wine and one liter of children's urine to boil until dry. Pound to the desired consistency, mix in the minced Wu Yi, and pound again to blend. Form into pills the size of Chinese parasol seeds, taking twenty pills each time with a drink.[198p]

　　赵氏斧槌丸　治小儿疳，久服肥白。　　芦荟　熊胆各一钱　干虾(虫麻)一枚　白矾　胆矾　绿矾各半两。四味同入罐内烧，矾枯为度　京三棱　石三棱　鸡爪三棱　萆薢　鹤虱　雷丸　淡芜荑　黑狗脊　南木香各半两　三枚使君子　十枚没石子　　右为末，醋煮干枣，取肉烂研，入少面糊，和药极熟，丸如菉豆大，每服七丸，米饮下。

　　秘方肥儿丸　消疳进食。

Secret Formula for Feeding Pills: for dispersing malnutrition and enhancing appetite.

Zhu Family's Heirloom Recipe: for treating children's spleen rashes, malnutrition, fright, and accumulation.

Sheng Hui Ginseng Pills: for treating children's exposure to dew, exposure to wind while improperly clothed, abdominal distension with diarrhea, or cold and heat resembling malaria, lack of appetite, and inability to gain weight or digest, with emaciated limbs.
Ingredients: 1 liang each of Ginseng, roasted Mai Men Dong (heart removed), half Yao Sam-Xiao Gan washed seven times and dried; 3 fen each of Huang Qi, slightly toasted Da Huang, Bai Fu Ling, Chai Hu, and Huang Qin; 1 liang of He Li Le skin, Zheng Cao, and 1 liang of soft-shelled turtle shell processed to remove the skirt; half a liang of Xiong Dan. 　　醍醐散　治吐泻后调和脾胃，消进饮食，及丁奚哺露，虚热烦渴，气逆恶心。　　陈皮　砂仁　厚朴姜汁浸一宿。慢火焙干　麦芽洗净焙　乌梅各五钱　良姜銼东壁土炒　干葛　乌药各二钱半　草果仁炮，二钱　炙草三钱　　右碎，每服二钱，水一盏，姜二片，枣一枚，盐少许，煎七分，空心温服。
　　快活丸　治丁奚疳，皮肤瘦削，骨露如柴，肚大青筋，小便白浊，睡卧烦躁，神气昏沉。常服健脾化积，进食肥肌。　　蒸饼一两，去顶剜空，入青矾半钱，仍以碎饼屑紧塞，上用水纸封定，灰火中炮透，取出候冷用之　　右件銼焙为末，别以肥枣用米泔水浸经一宿，饭上蒸少时，去皮核，用乳钵烂杵如糊，同前饼末停分再杵匀，丸麻仁大，每服三十丸至五十丸，温米清汤无时送下。儿小者，亦以米汤化服。其蒸饼不拘个数，大约以一两入青矾半钱重为定，下常如前法制半斤作一料，后人切勿以见方不重药为误，余尝屡试屡验。其饼如南馒头样是也。[201p]

Dihua San: Treats vomiting and diarrhea, harmonizes the spleen and stomach, aids digestion, and addresses thirst caused by deficiency heat. Ingredients: Chenpi, sharen, houpo soaked in ginger juice overnight, slowly roasted until dry; malt cleaned and roasted; five qian each of black plum; good ginger chopped, stir-fried with earth from the eastern wall; dried kudzu and wuyao each two and a half qian; grass fruit seeds roasted, two qian; roasted grass three qian. These ingredients should be crushed. Dosage: two qian each time, with one cup of water, two slices of ginger, one jujube, and a pinch of salt, decocted until reduced to seven parts and taken warm on an empty stomach.

Kuaihuowan: Treats the condition known as Dingxi with symptoms of emaciated skin, exposed bones, distended abdomen with visible veins, turbid urination, restlessness during sleep, and dull spirit. Regular use strengthens the spleen and resolves accumulation, promotes intake of nutrients. Ingredients: One liang of steamed cake, top removed and hollowed out, half qian of blue vitriol added, then packed tightly with crumbled cake, sealed with wet paper, roasted in ash until dry, then cooled for use.

Crush the above into powder, separately soak fat jujubes in rice washing water overnight, steam briefly, remove skin and pits, then grind in a mortar to a paste, mix with the previously prepared cake powder and grind uniformly again into balls the size of hemp seeds. Dosage: thirty to fifty balls at a time, taken with warm rice soup at any time. For children, it can also be dissolved in rice soup. The number of cakes is not fixed; generally, half a qian of blue vitriol is used for every liang, and a total of half a jin should be prepared using the same method as before. Later practitioners should not mistakenly think that less is better because the recipes do not seem to require a lot of medicinal ingredients, as I have repeatedly tested and verified this. The cakes should resemble southern steamed buns.[201p]

Yingru Shaoyaowan treats children's colds, fevers, abdominal distension, undigested food, and muscle development issues. The ingredients are:

Zhang Huan's Great Musk Pill treats children who are emaciated, with a distended abdomen showing blue veins, as well as similar ailments.

Ingredients:

  • Musk, ground
  • Cinnabar, finely ground and water floated
  • Frost powder, finely ground, each half a tael
  • Five spirit resin
  • Nutmeg kernel
  • Dried toad treated with fat and roasted, each one tael
  • Night-bright sand
  • White alum ash, each half a tael
  • Dried earth dragon, roasted, one part
  • Seven dried beetles, wings removed, roasted until yellow

Prepare by grinding and sifting these ingredients into a fine powder, mix evenly with cinnabar, and refine with honey into balls the size of millet. Take three to five grains each time, swallowed with warm water, adjusting the dosage based on the child's size.

Single prescription:

For emaciated children: Use three taels of licorice, scorched into a powder, form into honey balls the size of mung beans, taking five balls in warm water twice daily.

For child's dysentery: Boil earth buckthorn and reduce the juice to syrup, then take it.

For treating wet-nurse issues: Mash fresh garlic root and stew in pig fat; or roast mouse meat for nursing.[203p]

　　治小儿疳湿疮：用铁衣着下部，即瘥。 【《千金方》，下同】
　　治小儿疳疮：以猪脂和胡粉傅之，日五六度。　　又：嚼麻子傅之，日五六度。
　　又：羊胆二枚，和酱汁，于下部灌之；猪脂亦佳。
　　治小儿鬾病：炙伏冀熟，嚼哺之。
　　又：烧伏翼末，饮服之。

　　小儿鬾病：寒热如疳，用冬瓜仁、扁蓄各四两，水二升，煎汤洗之。
　　小儿蛔病羸瘦：猪膏服之。一云治蛲虫。
　　小儿疳痢频数；用生蔷薇根洗切，煎浓汁细饮。
　　治小儿蛔虫：削楝木上苍皮，以水煮取汁饮之，量大小多少为之。此有小毒，或为末，米饮服二钱。
　　治小儿羸瘦有蛔虫：以雚芦二两，水一升，米二合煮，取米熟，去滓与服。　　又：用扁蓄三两，水一升，煮取四合，分服或捣汁服。　　又：以桃白皮三两，东引吴茱萸根白皮四两，二味 (口父)咀以酒一升，二合渍之，一宿渐与服取，瘥 。　　又：捣槐子内下部中自瘥。[204p]

Treating children's damp and sores: Use iron clothing on the lower body, and it will heal.

For treating children's damp sores: Mix pig lard with starch and apply it five to six times a day. Another method: Chew sesame seeds and apply five to six times a day.

Additionally: Take two sheep gallbladders, mix with sauce, and inject into the lower body; pig lard is also good.

For treating children's diarrhea: Roast Fuzhu and chew while feeding.

Another method: Burn Fuyang powder and drink it.

Children's diarrhea: Cold and heat like dampness, use winter melon seeds and pigweed, each four taels, boil in two sheng of water to wash.

For children with thinness due to roundworms: Take pig fat to consume. Some say it also treats pinworms.

For frequent diarrhea in children: Wash and cut fresh rose roots, then boil to make a thick juice to drink.

To treat children's roundworms: Peel the upper bark of the neem tree, boil it with water to extract juice, and drink according to size. This contains slight toxicity; alternatively, grind it into powder and take two qian with rice drink.

For thin children with roundworms: Use two taels of wild rice and one sheng of water, boil with two he of rice, and take the cooked rice after removing the residue. Another method: Use three taels of pigweed, boil with one sheng of water to extract four he, divide and consume or squeeze and drink the juice. Also: Use three taels of peach white skin and four taels of root white skin of Wu zhu yu, chew together, soak in one sheng of wine, let it sit overnight, and gradually consume to heal. Additionally, pound locust seeds and apply to the lower body for self-healing.[204p]

　　又：楝实一枚内孔中。

　　治白虫：以东行石榴皮一把，水一升，煮取三合分服。　　又：捣桃叶绞取汁服之。

　　治小儿三虫：以雷丸、芎藭等分为末，服一钱，日二。
　　小儿疳瘦，久服消食和气，长肌肉：用陈橘皮一两，黄连以米泔水浸一日，一两半，研末，入麝三分，猪胆盛药，以浆水煮熟，取出用粟米饭和丸菉豆大，每服一二十丸，米饮下。【《钱氏小儿方》，下同】
　　小儿疳热，有虫瘦瘁：用榆仁一两、黄连一两为末，猪胆汁七枚，和入碗内，饭上蒸之，一日蒸一次，九蒸乃入麝香半钱，汤浸蒸饼和丸菉豆大，每服五七丸至一二十丸，米饮下。久服充肥。[205p]

Furthermore: One seed of the tree of heaven has a hole in the center.

To treat white worms: Use one handful of pomegranate peel, one liter of water, boil to obtain three cups, and take in divided doses. Additionally: Crush peach leaves and extract the juice to consume.

To treat three types of worms in children: Use thunder herb and cyperus in equal parts, grind into powder, and take one qian (a small unit of weight) twice daily.
For children suffering from malnutrition, prolonged consumption of this remedy aids in digestion, harmonizes Qi, and promotes muscle growth: Use one Liang of aged tangerine peel, soak one and a half Liang of yellow rice in the water from washing rice for a day, grind into powder, adding three Fen (another weight measure) of musk. Fill pig gallbladders with the medicine, cook this with rice water, take out and mix with millet rice to form pills the size of mung beans, taking twenty pills at a time with rice drink.
For children with fever due to worms causing emaciation: Use one Liang each of elm seeds and yellow lotus powder, seven pig gallbladders’ worth of bile, mix this in a bowl, and steam once a day, doing this for nine days. At the end of this, add half a qian of musk and make into pills the size of mung beans, taking five to twenty pills with rice drink. Prolonged use will increase weight.[205p]

　　小儿脾疳：使君子、芦荟等分为末，米饮一钱。 【《儒门事亲》】
　　小儿疳泻吐利：白药子一两、甘草半两为末，猪肝一具，批开掺末五钱，煮熟食之。 【《直指方》，下同】
　　小儿鬾病：以红纱袋盛夜明砂佩之。
　　小儿疳痢：薤白生捣如泥，以粳米粉和蜜作饼，炙熟与食，不过三两服。 【《杨氏产乳》】
　　解小儿疳热疳痢杀虫：用青黛，不以多少，水研服。 【《宫气方》】
　　疗小儿瘦头干无辜兼痢：用马齿苋捣绞汁，服三合，以瘥止。 【《外台》方，下同】
　　治疳痢晓夜无度者：取樗根浓汁及粟米泔各一鸡子壳许，以竹筒吹入下部，再度瘥。
　　治疳痢大孔开，痢不止：以黄连末入麝香少许和匀，以竹筒吹入。

Childhood malnutrition: Ground Si Jun Zi and aloe into powder, mix with one penny of rice drink.

Childhood diarrhea and vomiting: One tael of white herb and half a tael of licorice ground into powder, mix with one pig liver, open it up, add five qian of the powder, and cook thoroughly to eat.

Childhood tapeworm disease: Use a red gauze bag to hold night-shining sand as an amulet.

Childhood dysentery: Crush fresh garlic into a paste, mix it with glutinous rice flour and honey to make cakes, roast and eat no more than three taels.

To dispel childhood heat-related dysentery and kill parasites: Use Qing Dai, in unspecified quantity, ground in water to consume.

To treat childhood emaciation and dysentery: Use purslane, crush and squeeze the juice, take three doses until healed.

To treat dysentery that occurs day and night without respite: Take concentrated juice from the root of the common walnut and mixed with millet wash, about one eggshell worth, blow it into the lower region distinctly, and heal again.

To treat severe dysentery with large openings, where diarrhea does not stop: Mix powdered Huang Lian with a little musk and ensure it is uniform, blowing it into the body with a bamboo tube.

Childhood sore dysentery: Chew fresh chestnuts and apply them.

For severely troubled childhood dysentery: Use white mulberry bark ground into powder, mix with water to make a soup the size of a jujube, expose it to the sun for a short time and mix, repeat three times, then boil with water until cooked, swallow seven pieces on an empty stomach, and no more than seven doses for severe cases. Avoid greasy or hot foods and toxic substances.[206p]

　　小儿一切疳疾：用自死蜗壳七枚，皮薄色黄白者，洗净，不得少有尘滓，日干，内酥蜜于壳中，以瓷盏盛之，盖纸糊盏面，置炊饭上蒸之，下甑时即坐甑中，仍装饭，候蒸饭熟取出，研如水淀，渐渐与吃，一日令尽取效止。【《圣惠方》，下同】
　　五疳下痢：兔屎炒半两，干虾(虫麻)一枚，烧灰为末，绵裹如莲子大，纳下部，日三易之。
　　小儿诸疳：棘针、瓜蒂等，研为末，吹入鼻中，日三次。
　　小儿急疳疮：水调蚺蛇胆敷之。

　　小儿吃泥及肚胀：用腻粉一分，沙糖和丸麻子大，空心米饮下一丸，良久泄出泥土瘥。【《经验方》，下同】
　　走马牙疳：用鸡肫黄皮不落水者五枚，枯矾五钱，研搽立愈。
　　治小儿无辜痢赤白兼成疳：用胡粉熟蒸，熬令色变，以饮服之。 【《子母秘录》，下同】
　　治一岁至二岁无辜病：用夜明砂熬捣为散，任意拌饭，并吃食与吃。三岁号干无辜。[207p]

For all kinds of childhood ailments: Use seven pieces of dead snail shells, thin-skinned and yellowish-white. Clean them thoroughly to remove any dirt, then dry in the sun. Add honey inside the shells, place them in a porcelain cup, cover the mouth with paper, and steam over boiling rice. Once the rice is cooked, remove the cup, grind the contents until watery, and gradually have the child consume it until finished for effect.

For five kinds of diarrhea: Fry half a tael of rabbit droppings, add one piece of dried shrimp, burn them to ash and grind into powder. Wrap in cotton to the size of a lotus seed and insert in the lower body, changing it three times a day.

For various childhood ailments: Grind thorn needles and gourd stems into powder and blow it into the nose three times a day.

For urgent sores in children: Mix water with snake bile and apply it.

For children who eat dirt and have a bloated stomach: Use one part of greasy powder, mix with sand sugar to form a ball the size of a millet seed, have the child swallow one ball with hollow rice drink, and after a while, it will expel the dirt.

For horse-related tooth ailments: Use five unboiled chicken gizzards with yellow skin and five cash of alum; grind and apply for immediate healing.

For treating innocent children with mixed red and white diarrhea: Use prepared white powder, steam it until changed in color, and have the child drink it.

For treating innocent sickness in children aged one to two years: Use night-bright sand, grind into powder, and mix with food as desired. By the age of three, label as innocent illness.[207p]

　　小儿疳疾：椿白皮日干二两为末，以粟米淘净，研汁和丸梧子大，十岁三四丸，米饮下，量大小加减，仍似一丸纳竹筒中，吹入鼻内三度，良。

　　小儿嗜土：买市中羊肉一斤，令人以绳系，于地上拽至家，洗净沙炙食，或煮汁亦可。【《姚和众方》，下同】

　　小儿一切疳疾：六月取粪坑中蛆淘浸，入竹筒中封之，待干研末，每服一二钱，入麝香，米饮下。【《圣济总录》，下同】　　又：用蛆蜕，米泔逐日换浸五日，再以清水换浸三日，晒焙为末，入黄连末等分，每半两入麝香五分，以豮猪胆汁和丸黍米大，每服三四十丸，米饮下，神效。[208p]

Childhood malnutrition: Take two taels of dried white mulberry bark, grind it into powder, mix with clean millet water, and form pills the size of a jujube. For a ten-year-old, take three to four pills, adjusting the quantity based on size. Deem it satisfactory to place one pill into a bamboo tube and blow into the nose three times.

For children with fallen hair, brittle yellow hair, or weak from scrofula: pound dried apple cores into powder and mix with vinegar for application.

For children with cold malnutrition, yellow faces, and swollen bellies who vomit upon eating: take seven cloves of mother clove, grind into powder, mix with breast milk, and steam three times, then take with ginger soup.

For children who crave dirt: buy one pound of lamb from the market, have it tied with a rope, dragged home, wash off the sand, roast to eat, or boil for soup as an option.

For children who have an appetite for soil: take good yellow earth, mix it with the juice of boiled Coptis, dry it in the sun, and give it to eat.

For all types of childhood malnutrition: in June, obtain maggots from a manure pit, wash and soak them, place them in a bamboo tube sealed tightly, wait until dry, then grind into powder. Each dose is one to two qian, mixed with musk, taken with millet water.

Additionally: use the molted maggots, soak them in rice wash, changing daily for five days, then switch to clear water soaking for three days, sun-dry and bake into powder. Mix with equal parts of Coptis powder; for every half tael, add five fen of musk, mixing with gallbladder juice of a feral pig, and form into pills the size of glutinous rice. Each dose is three to forty pills taken with millet water, showing significant effectiveness.[208p]

Children's malnutrition with diarrhea, caused by imbalance of heat and cold: Half a tael of Hu Huanglian and one tael of minced ginger, powdered and taken in half a qian with Glycyrrhiza decoction.

For children's malnutrition: Take equal parts of water beads, gan sui stir-fried, and green tangerine peel, ground into powder. For a three-year-old, use one qian, combined with malt decoction, to promote elimination. Avoid sour and salty foods for three to five days.

For children's malnutrition: Brew Tian Nanzhu into a soup for drinking.

To treat eating dirt: Use oily powder and sand sugar, formed into pills the size of sesame seeds, taken with plain rice drink.

For malnutrition due to eating soil and living things: Calcine soapstone and make into pills with pig bile, taken with two or three dozen rice drinks.

In cases of malnutrition and dysentery leading to imminent death: Take one sheng of fresh sheep dung and one sheng of water, soak overnight, then squeeze out the juice and take it all at once; eat only at noon.

For malnutrition accumulation: One golden-eyed toad, remove its head, feet, and intestines, with one sheng of maggots, all placed in new tiles, tied tightly with iron wire at both ends, and roasted slowly until crisp. Add tile fluff and other herbs, and for vomiting and diarrhea, include wood incense and tangerine peel powdered, taken with five fen of white soup.

For children's malnutrition accumulation, characterized by a big belly, yellowish appearance, thin and bony limbs, and sores on the head resembling wheat spikes: Use a toad after the beginning of autumn, remove its head, feet, and intestines, coat it with clear oil, roast it on yin and yang tiles until cooked, then consume. The accumulated filth will be expelled naturally. After taking five or six doses, the appearance will change significantly and be beyond words.[211p]

　　小儿热疳，尿如疳，大便不调：粪蛆烧灰，杂物与食。
　　小儿继病者，母有娠乳儿，儿病如疟痢，他日相继腹大，或瘥或发，他人有娠相近，亦能相继也，宜取伯劳鸟毛与儿带之。

　　　　针灸

　　《千金方》曰：小儿疳湿疮，灸第十五椎夹脊两傍七壮；未瘥加七壮。　　《原机启微》曰：小儿疳眼，灸合谷二穴各一壮，炷如小麦大，手大指次指两骨间陷者中。　　田氏曰：小儿疳瘦，于胸下骨尖上灸三壮，次于脊下端尾翠骨尾上灸三壮。　　小儿疳瘦，脱肛体瘦，渴饮，形容瘦悴，诸方不瘥者，取尾翠骨上三寸骨陷中，灸三壮。　　小儿身羸瘦，贲豚腹肿，四肢懈惰，肩背不举，章门二穴各灸七壮。　　《医学纲目》曰：疮蚀龂断，臭秽冲人者，灸劳宫一壮。　　《古今医统》曰：小儿多疳者，是脑门被风拍着及肺寒也，灸顖会一穴二壮。在上星上一寸，直鼻上。　　小儿羸瘦，饮食少进，不生肌肉，灸胃俞二穴各一壮，在十二椎下两傍，各开一寸半陷中。[219p]

Acupuncture

The "Thousand Gold Prescriptions" states: For children with dampness and malnutrition, moxibustion is applied to both sides of the fifteenth vertebra with seven cones; if not healed, add seven more. The "Original Mechanisms Unveiled" comments: For children's malnutrition affecting the eyes, moxibustion should be done on the Hegu points, with one cone each, using a moxa stick the size of a wheat grain, placed in the indentation between the thumb and the index finger. Tian’s method suggests: For children who are emaciated, moxibustion should be applied with three cones on the bone tip beneath the chest, and subsequently three cones above the tailbone at the lower end of the spine. If a child is emaciated, has prolapsed rectum, feels thirsty, and appears gaunt, where other treatments have failed, place three cones in the indentation three inches above the tailbone. In cases of children who are thin, have ascites, lazy limbs, and shoulders that do not lift, moxibustion should be done on the Zhangmen points with seven cones each. The "Medical Essentials" notes: For sores that are foul and smell offensive, moxibustion on the Laogong point with one cone is advised. The "Ancient and Modern Medical System" states: Children who are often malnourished may have a blocked brain due to wind exposure or cold in the lungs; thus, moxibustion on the Shenting point should be done with two cones. At the Xiang points, one inch above, directly on the nose. If a child is emaciated, has little appetite, and does not gain muscle, moxibustion should be applied on the Weishu points with one cone each, located one and a half inches on each side below the twelfth vertebra.[219p]

　　　　医案

　　钱氏论用药识证曰：郑人齐郎中者，家好收药散施人，其子忽脏热，齐自取青金膏二服并一服而饵之。服毕，至三更泻五行，其子困睡。齐言子睡多因惊，又与青金膏一服，又泻二行，加口干而身热。齐言尚有微热未尽，又与青金膏。其妻曰：用药十余行未安，莫生病否？召钱氏，曰：已成虚羸。先多煎白朮散，时时服之，后用香瓜丸，十三日愈。[220p]

Medical Case Study

Qian's Commentary on the Use of Medicine states: A physician from Zheng, named Qi, was known for taking in herbal remedies and distributing them to people. His son suddenly developed symptoms of internal heat. Qi himself took two doses of Qingjin ointment and one additional dose, administering it to his son. After taking the medicine, by the third watch, the son had five bouts of diarrhea and was exhausted from sleep. Qi remarked that his son slept too much due to fright, and gave him another dose of Qingjin ointment, which resulted in two more bouts of diarrhea, along with a dry mouth and a feverish body. Qi noted there was still slight heat remaining and administered another dose of Qingjin. His wife questioned: "After using the medicine over ten times, the condition is still unstable; could this create a new illness?" They called upon Qian, who said: "He has already become weak and emaciated." Initially, they brewed Bai Zhu powder, which was taken several times, and later used Xianggua pills. The son recovered after thirteen days.[220p]

　　《医学纲目》曰：一富家子年十四岁，面黄，善啖易饥，非肉不饱，泄泻一月，来求治。脉之，两手皆大，怪不甚瘦倦，以为湿热，当脾困而食少，今反形健而食多，且不渴，余意其疾必疳虫作痢也，取大便视之，果蛔虫所为。适往他处，有一小儿医在侧，教其用治虫药治之，禁其勿用去积药，约回途当为一看诊而止痢也。偶弗果至。次年春夏之交，其泻复作，腹不痛而口干，此去年治虫而不治疳故也。遂以去疳热之药，浓煎白朮汤下，三日而泻止。半月后偶过其家，见其子甚瘦，余教以白朮为君，芍药为臣，川芎、陈皮、黄连、胡黄连，入少芦荟为丸，白朮汤服之，半月而止。禁其勿食肉与甜物，三年当自愈。[221p]

The "Medical Compendium" states: A wealthy family's son, aged fourteen, had a sallow complexion, was prone to hunger, and felt full only after eating meat. He had been suffering from diarrhea for a month and came seeking treatment. Upon checking his pulse, both hands were large, and though he was not excessively thin or fatigued, I suspected damp-heat and a deficiency of the spleen leading to poor appetite. However, he appeared healthy and had a large appetite, and he wasn’t thirsty, which made me think his condition was caused by intestinal worms resulting in dysentery. I examined his stool and found it indeed was due to roundworms. There happened to be a young doctor nearby who advised using anti-worm medicine and forbade him from taking any accumulating medications, agreeing to check on him on the way back to stop the diarrhea. Unfortunately, he did not make it to the appointment.

In the spring and summer of the following year, the diarrhea recurred, but without abdominal pain and with a dry mouth, likely due to the previous failure to treat the dysentery properly. So, I administered a remedy to eliminate the heat of dysentery, boiling a strong white atractylodes decoction, and within three days the diarrhea stopped. Half a month later, when I passed by his home, I saw the boy was very thin. I recommended using white atractylodes as the chief herb, peony as the deputy, along with ligusticum, dried tangerine peel, 黄连 (golden thread), and hu huang lian (the bitter herb), combining them with a small amount of aloe to form pills to be taken with the white atractylodes decoction. After half a month, the symptoms ceased. I advised that he abstain from meat and sweet foods, and he would recover completely in three years.[221p]

　　《保婴金镜录》曰：一小儿眼泡微肿，咳嗽恶心，小便泔白，余谓脾疳食积，脾气虚甚也，以五味异功散为主，佐以四味肥儿丸而愈。后不禁饮食，视物不明。余曰：此脾胃复伤，须补养为主。不信，乃服峻厉之剂，后变风证，竟为不起。
　　一小儿四肢消瘦，肚腹渐大，寒热嗜卧，作渴引饮。余曰：证属肝脾，名为丁奚哺露也。以白朮散为主，佐以徐氏十全丹，月余诸证渐愈；乃以异功散加当归，及六味丸，又月余寻愈。
　　一小儿患前证，诸疳悉具，热如火炙，病状不能尽述。朝用异功散，夕用四味肥儿丸，月余，诸证稍愈；佐以地黄丸，自能行立；遂朝以地黄丸，夕以异功散及虾蟆丸数服而全愈。[222p]

The "Baoying Jinjing Lu" states: A small child had slightly swollen eyelids, a cough with nausea, and cloudy urine. I diagnosed this as a spleen dampness and food accumulation, indicative of severely weakened spleen qi. I prescribed Wuwei Yigong powder as the main treatment, complemented with Simwei Fei'er pill, and he recovered. Later, without dietary restrictions, his vision became unclear. I remarked that this was due to further damage to the spleen and stomach, and he needed nourishment as the primary focus. Disbelieving, he took harsh remedies and later developed wind syndrome, ultimately resulting in his inability to recover.

Another child had emaciated limbs, an increasingly distended abdomen, cold and hot symptoms, with a constant desire for drink. I diagnosed this as a liver-spleen issue, termed Dingxi butter. I used Baizhu powder as the main treatment, supplemented with Xu's Shiquan pill. After a month, the symptoms gradually improved; I then added Yigong powder with Danggui and Liuwei pill, and after another month, he fully recovered.

For a child with the previous symptoms, all signs of dampness were present, accompanied by heat like fire, and the condition could not be fully described. In the morning, I used Yigong powder, and in the evening, the Simwei Fei'er pill. After over a month, the symptoms slightly improved; I supplemented with Dihuang pill, which allowed him to walk and stand independently. Eventually, he took Dihuang pill in the morning and Yigong powder along with Xiafa pill in the evening for several doses and was completely cured.[222p]

　　一小儿言步未能，牙发犹少，体瘦骨立，面赤作渴，服肥儿丸不应。余谓此肾虚疳证，乃禀父精气不足故也。盖肥儿丸，脾胃经之药也，久服则肾益虚而疳益甚。不信，果牙发渐落。余用六味地黄丸加鹿茸、五味子，半载元气健而诸证愈。
　　一小儿十岁，患疮疥久不愈，肌体羸瘦，寒热时作，脑热足冷，滑泻肚痛，龈烂口臭，干渴，爪黑面黧，此肾疳也。服六味地黄丸，更搽解毒散而愈。
　　一小儿项结一核，坚硬如疬，面色萎黄，饮食不甘，服托里药不应，此无辜疳毒也。余以蟾蜍丸治之而愈。若数服不消，按之转动，软而不痛者，内有虫如粉，宜急针去之。若不速去，则虫随气走，内蚀脏腑，不治。
　　《外科心法》曰：一小儿眉皱多啼，呕吐清沫，腹中作痛，肚胀筋青，唇口紫黑，肛门作痒，名曰蛔疳。以大芦荟丸治之而愈。

A young child struggled to walk, had few teeth, was thin with prominent bones, had a red face and thirst, and did not respond to the Fat Child Pills. I believed this was due to kidney deficiency and malnutrition, stemming from insufficient paternal essence. The Fat Child Pills are for the spleen and stomach; long-term use would only worsen the kidney deficiency and malnutrition. If you doubt this, the teeth would gradually fall out. I gave him the Six-Flavor Rehmannia Pill and applied a detoxifying powder, resulting in recovery.
